headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. And then today, by Tobías Martinez, CEO of Cellnex; with José Manuel Aisa, CFO and Managing Director presentation. I would like to thank you all for joi
componenttext: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. And then today, by Tobías Martinez, CEO of Cellnex; with José Manuel Aisa, CFO and Managing Director presentation. I would like to thank you all for joining us today for Cellnex 2015 [indiscernible] our conference call. We'll today of the presentation which we will refer to our prepared remarks on the Investor Relations section on our website. And then we'll open them up for Q&A session. Now I turn now to Tobías Martinez. Please, Tobias.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Juan Jose. Good afternoon, everyone. Thank you so very much for your time today and please allow me to start by highlighting that we are very proud to present again a solid set of results. Results of our projects progressing and our core activi
componenttext:
Thank you, Juan Jose. Good afternoon, everyone. Thank you so very much for your time today and please allow me to start by highlighting that we are very proud to present again a solid set of results. Results of our projects progressing and our core activities delivering a continued strong organic growth with sustainment demand, our portfolio of assets and services. 
If we moved to Slide #4, I would like to start by highlighting that 2015 have been a year of deliveries. We have met the guidance we shared with you, and we have show supporting 2014 our activity in our 3 strategic pillars. The first one is the organic growth. Organic growth means maximization of our existing portfolio to capture new revenues while efficiently managing our cost structure. hence, delivering an attractive operating leverage. The second one is to keep a robust quality with flexible access to debt and capital markets. The objective is to have a stable long-term balance sheet and a competitive cost, while retaining the financing flexibility required to capture new growth opportunities. And the third one, we are willing to play the role in the consolidation of the power landscape in Europe. In this sense, I would like to emphasize that our geographical focus is Europe. But our is better than nature allows us to reaching a long-term partner for our customers. And that's the only reason why we will execute a transaction is because we will create value our stockholders. And to ensure this is the case, we have a strict investment discipline. 
We move through Slide #5. We can approach 2 statistic examples that illustrate our strategic pillars. Organic growth in the Telecom Site Rental business had been strong in 2015 with an increase of PoPs of 8% mainly due to a multi-tenantcy services. That means more customers on our towers because they require additional locations mainly for a 4G rollout. Production of covenant debts and higher diversification mainly in the urban areas. It is also important to mention that after just 9 months of operations in Italy, the company that runs the towers we acquired from WIND in Italy, we have managed it to increase our tenancy ratio in the country. Thus, meeting our acquisition business plan so far.  I think this is a very good news for everyone. 
Looking into 2016 onwards, we believe the main driver for organic growth will be the rationalization of networks and in order to capture this growth, we have today identified around 2,000 towers that can be dismantled in this 2 countries we are present. We are actively and constantly working with different operators and we expect to present to you good news on this front in the very short term. The economical benefits of this new activity should start being visible from 2016, [ph] 2017. Moving to Slide #6, here you can see the main characteristics of our current debt structure. As a result of the refinancing process we carried out last year, we have managed to extend our maturities at a competitive cost, removed any additional covenants which might constrain our future growth, partially hedge our interest rates and diversify our sources of funds. This creates the appropriate platform to continue pursuing and manage progress, which are analyzed under strict validation criteria with a view to maximize leverage free cash flow per share, while minimizing the need for capital increases. With this capital structure in place, we will face no financial risks for the next 6 years as the first maturity in 2017 can be easily repaid with the cash generated by the group during this period. Our leverage stands today at EUR 927 million with the leverage ratio of 3.7x net debt EBITDA. 
Moving to Slide #7. This is just to remind you of the excellent M&A execution we have carried out during the last 4 years. We have an average acquisition of 2,000 towers per year at which has allowed us to grow at the low mid-teens CAGR in terms of adjusted EBITDA and recurring leveraging cash flow. And what's the next? Our first priority is to consolidate our processing Spain and Italy, and then we want to continue pursuing new projects in the main European countries like U.K., France and Germany. And these countries offer very attractive market dynamics and interesting opportunities that we are currently assessing. I would now like to hand over to José Manuel Aisa, our CFO, who will provide you more details on this front.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Tobías. I would like to take this opportunity to of the current status of our potential acquisition of Inwit. As you all know, we have to make it a Italian fund a nonbinding offer for a stake in Inwit that would trigger a mandatory tender of 1
componenttext: Thank you, Tobías. I would like to take this opportunity to of the current status of our potential acquisition of Inwit. As you all know, we have to make it a Italian fund a nonbinding offer for a stake in Inwit that would trigger a mandatory tender of 100% of the company. We are today working on the second stake resulted and intend to submit our binding offer by this month. [ph] It is worth mentioning the importance in these kinds of projects of engaging a strategic local partner to capitalize an important no less financial standing of the project's framework. Our of an industrial player. We need to control the assets we acquire in order just to and to become a long-term partner of our client and to provide additional services in the future. The financing will be infrastructure has been approved by several leading financial institutions and cover the total value of the target. Finally, this transaction order remain in the future will only be carried out if we meet our strict investment criteria. First, [ph] only 10% equity IRR on a project standalone basis. Second, recurring level free cash flow per share accretion from year 2, 3 onwards and on a consolidating basis. And finally, an increased delevering capacity for acquisition when compared to the previous situation. Tobias, I think this.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Let's moved to Slide #9. And this is again to remind you that we have met the guidance we share with you back in August and that is constitutes an excellent starting point to meet 2016 market expectations. We have posted an adjusted EBITDA in line w
componenttext:
Okay. Let's moved to Slide #9. And this is again to remind you that we have met the guidance we share with you back in August and that is constitutes an excellent starting point to meet 2016 market expectations. We have posted an adjusted EBITDA in line with market expectations, maintenance CapEx has been slightly below, working capital change is slightly positive thanks to our proactive management, interest payments have been very well contained and cash tax had been in with what we anticipated. All these leads to our net debt position as of end of the year below market expectations. 
If we move to Slide #10, these strong deliveries has also been recognized by the market during 2016, [indiscernible] share price up to 23% when compared to our ideal price of EUR 14 per share and a 38% [ph] outperformance when compared to the index. Our share price has recently experienced a high degree of volatility, but our fundamentals remain equally strong and market estimates has been maintained, providing a target price of around EUR 18 per share with max side potential of 27%. 
Moving to Slide #11, it is important to make emphasis again on our ability to withstand the of services we can provide over our current asset base and with our available resources. As already discussed, 2015 has been a year when multi-tenancy has provide us with a very strong organic growth and 2016 will be a year when rationalization projects will play a key role. But we are also actively monitoring and analyzing new potential business lines, which may provide us with future revenues and streams. Built to suit is an area where we will use an opportunistic approach. Today, we already have an agreement with WIND in Italy to build 400 towers over 6 years. In 2014, we entered into an agreement with for the deployment of the first global network with national coverage in Spain. We are now looking at expanding these network by adding new locations. A field where we also see an opportunity is backhaul, which consists of acquiring the right of use of existing fiber-to-the-tower or the deployment of new fiber where such an alternative is not available. This will represent a way to increase the effectiveness of our portfolio, and we will be able to offer high-speed connectivity. That's avoiding future capacities bottlenecks if that data demand continues rising at the current rates. And the economics are similar to our core business. CapEx is deployed on an that can be shared across multiple customers in exchange for a long-term contract. We are asserting potential revenues from what we call managed services. Advisory services for operators in noncore countries in order to help them with tower outsourcing processes. These services may include assistance during the pre-acquisition stage of towers supporting the transfer of assets to the new TowerCo, as well as supporting the further M&A plans. It is worth mentioning that this not equity contribution by service. 
In addition to our traditional macro tower business, we are also accessing the potential to increase our presence in the small cell tower. We currently have a 8-year contract with the Barcelona municipality by which we can sell collocation services for small cells placed through the city. In this regard and leveraging on this concept, we are pleased to announce to you that we have just reached an agreement with to deploy the first small cell network in Barcelona, with the potential to add more operators in the future into this network. 
If we moved to Slide #12. We described our experience in the areas of the small cells, IOT and As I have just mentioned it, we already have a contract with the municipality of Barcelona which grant access to the infrastructure and public locations in order to serve collocation services for small cells. Such agreements are of key importance as having access to premium locations in urban area, and is the key differentiation factor when deploying a small cell network. Today, we are analyzing the possibility with different MNOs to initiate non-pilot project with the objective to shape the business model and the most feasible locations and provide high-capacity connectivity in areas of a strong data demand. As I just mentioned it, we have just reached an agreement with Orange for the deployment of the first small cell network in Barcelona. 
In the area of the Internet of Things, we have deployed a national coverage network data on technology for our customer security. To date, we provide the network infrastructure, backhaul connectivity and network maintenance, but we are also analyzing the possibility to expand our presence in other areas of the value chains. 
Finally, in the area of Smart Cities, we currently manage and maintain the Wi-Fi network of the city of Barcelona allowing us to offer innovative services to third party over this network such as Wi-Fi [indiscernible], it means active interconnection of access points or platform -- has a platform of offload, I mean mobile data download over Wi-Fi networks. 
Moving to Slide #13. Let me now please in this section reminding our main highlight for 2015. We are now a public company after a very successful IPO with the market supporting our equity story based on becoming the tower consolidator in Europe. We have managed to show a continued strong performance in the Telecom Site Rental business, basic and organic growth and accretive acquisitions, while setting the foundations of future organic opportunities. By the end of 2015, we held the position #25 in terms of market capitalization of the Spanish companies. The 20th of July we successfully complete our inaugural debt capital markets transaction with a EUR 600 million bond with a 7-year maturity and a coupon of 3.125%. The bond was 6x [ph] oversubscribed and has no covenants allowing for future growth. We carry out a transformational deal led on 1 year ago by acquiring 7,377 towers from WIND in Italy. The integration process of this new company is on track and we are extremely pleased with its performance better than anticipated. We have started implementing the first stage of our efficiency program. We have paid our first dividend. The national mass re-tendering process has been complete, and we are now working with our plus customers in order to accelerate the fusion. Additionally, with 700 megahertz run has been allocated through TV news. At least until 2026 [ph]. Finally, 6 months ago, we shared a guidance with you that we have met which proved our focus on delivery. Now please allow me to hand over to José Manuel Aisa who will explain you in detail our 2015 business from financial performance. Please, Jose Manuel.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today, by Tobías Martinez, CEO of Cellnex; with José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, who will lead today's presentation. I would like to t
componenttext: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today, by Tobías Martinez, CEO of Cellnex; with José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, who will lead today's presentation. I would like to thank you all for joining us today for Cellnex 2015 Full Year results conference call. We have, earlier today, posted a presentation, which we will refer to throughout our prepared remarks under the Investor Relations section on our website. And then we'll open the line for a Q&A session. Now I hand over to Tobías Martinez. Please, Tobías.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Juan Jose. Good afternoon, everyone. Thank you so very much for your time today and please allow me to start by highlighting that we are very proud to present again a solid set of results, with all of our projects progressing steadily and our c
componenttext:
Thank you, Juan Jose. Good afternoon, everyone. Thank you so very much for your time today and please allow me to start by highlighting that we are very proud to present again a solid set of results, with all of our projects progressing steadily and our core activities delivering a continued strong organic growth with sustained demand seen for our portfolio of assets and services. 
If we move to Slide #4, I would like to start by highlighting that 2015 have been a year of deliveries. We have met the guidance we shared with you, and we have done so supporting our activity in our 3 strategic pillars. The first one is the organic growth. Organic growth means maximization of our existing portfolio to capture new revenues while efficiently managing our cost structure hence delivering an attractive operating leverage. The second one is to keep a robust balance sheet with flexible access to debt and capital markets. The objective is to have a stable long-term balance sheet and a competitive cost, while retaining the financing flexibility required to capture new growth opportunities. And the third one, we are willing to play a key role in the consolidation of the power landscape in Europe. In this sense, I would like to emphasize that our geographical focus is Europe. But our [indiscernible] have been better than nature allows us to reaching a long-term partner for our customers. And that's the only reason why we will execute a transaction is because we will create value for our stockholders. And to ensure this is the case, we have a strict investment discipline. 
We move to Slide #5. We can approach 2 statistic examples that illustrate our strategic pillars. Organic growth in the Telecom Site Rental business has been strong in 2015 with an increase of PoPs of 8% mainly due to our multi-tenantcy services. That means more customers on our towers because they require additional locations mainly for a 4G rollout. Reduction of coverage gaps and higher densification mainly in the urban areas. It is also important to mention that after just 9 months of operations in Italy, the company that runs the towers we acquired from WIND in Italy, we have managed it to increase our tenancy ratio in the country. Thus, meeting our acquisition business plan so far. I think this is a very good news for everyone. 
Looking into 2016 onwards, we believe the main driver for organic growth will be the rationalization of our rapid networks. And in order to capture this growth, we have today identified around 2,000 towers that can be dismantled in the 2 countries we are present. We are actively and constantly working with different operators and we expect to present to you good news on this front in the very short term. The economical benefits of this new activity should start being visible from 2016, 2017. Moving to Slide #6. Here, you can see the main characteristics of our current debt structure. As a result of the refinancing process we carried out last year, we have managed to extend our maturities at a competitive cost, removed any additional covenants which might constrain our future growth, partially hedge our interest rates and diversify our sources of funds. This creates the appropriate platform to continue pursuing and manage projects, which are analyzed under strict value-creation criteria with a view to maximize levered free cash flow per share, while minimizing the need for capital increases. With this capital structure in place, we will face no financial risks for the next 6 years as the first maturity in 2020 can be easily repaid with the cash generated by the group during this period. Our leverage stands today at EUR 927 million with the leverage ratio of 3.7x net debt EBITDA. 
Moving to Slide #7. This is just to remind you of the excellent M&A execution we have carried out during the last 4 years with an average acquisition of 3,000 towers per year and which has allowed us to grow at the low mid-teens CAGR in terms of adjusted EBITDA and recurring leverage in cash flow. And what's the next? Our first priority is to consolidate our presence in Spain and in Italy, and then we want to continue pursuing new projects in the main European countries like U.K., France and Germany. And these countries offer very attractive market dynamics and interesting opportunities that we are currently assessing. I would now like to hand over to José Manuel Aisa, our CFO, who will provide you more details on this front.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Tobías. I would like to take this opportunity to update on the current status of our potential acquisition of Inwit. As you all know, we have submitted, along with the Italian fund F2i, a nonbinding offer for a stake in Inwit that would trigge
componenttext: Thank you, Tobías. I would like to take this opportunity to update on the current status of our potential acquisition of Inwit. As you all know, we have submitted, along with the Italian fund F2i, a nonbinding offer for a stake in Inwit that would trigger a mandatory tender of 100% of the company. We are today working on the second stake of the process and expect to submit our binding offer by mid-March. It is worth mentioning the importance in these kinds of projects of engaging a strategic local partner to capitalize an important no less financial standing of the project's framework. Our [indiscernible] is that of an industrial player. We need to control the assets we acquire in order to achieve full synergy and [indiscernible] to become a long-term partner of our client and to provide additional services in the future. The financing [indiscernible] has already been approved by several leading financial institutions and cover the total value of the target. Finally, this transaction and any order we make in the future will only be carried out if we meet our strict investment criteria. First on our list, 10% equity IRR on a project standalone basis. Second, recurring level free cash flow per share accretion from year 2, 3 onwards and on a consolidating basis. And finally, an increased delevering capacity post acquisition when compared to the previous situation. So Tobías, I think, is -- will have...

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Let's moved to Slide #9. And this is again to remind you that we have met the guidance we shared with you back in August and that is -- constitutes an excellent starting point to meet 2016 market expectations. We have posted an adjusted EBITDA in li
componenttext:
Okay. Let's moved to Slide #9. And this is again to remind you that we have met the guidance we shared with you back in August and that is -- constitutes an excellent starting point to meet 2016 market expectations. We have posted an adjusted EBITDA in line with market expectations, maintenance CapEx has been slightly below, working capital change is slightly positive thanks to our proactive management, interest payments have been very well contained and cash tax have been in line with what we anticipated. All these leads to a net debt position as of end of the year below market expectations. 
If we move to Slide #10, these strong deliveries has also been recognized by the market during 2015, with Cellnex share price up to 23% when compared to our ideal price of EUR 14 per share and a 38% outperformance when compared to the IBEX index. Our share price has recently experienced a high degree of volatility, but our fundamentals remain equally strong and market estimates has been maintained, providing a target price of around EUR 18 per share with an upside potential of 27%. 
Moving to Slide #11. It is important to make emphasis again on our ability to extend the array of services we can provide over our current asset base and with our available resources. As already discussed, 2015 has been a year when multi-tenancy has provide us with a very strong organic growth and 2016 will be a year when rationalization projects will play a key role. But we are also actively monitoring and analyzing new potential business lines, which may provide us with future revenue streams. Built to suit is an area where we will use an opportunistic approach. Today, we already have an agreement with WIND in Italy to build 400 towers over 6 years. In 2014, we entered into an agreement with Securitas Direct for the deployment of the first global IoT network with national coverage in Spain. We are now looking at expanding these networks by adding new locations. A field where we also see an opportunity is backhauling, which consists of acquiring the right of use of existing fiber-to-the-tower or the deployment of new fiber where such an alternative is not available. This will represent a way to increase the effectiveness of our portfolio, as we will be able to offer high-speed connectivity. That's avoiding future capacities bottlenecks if the data demand continues rising at the current rates. And the economics are similar to our core business. CapEx is deployed on an infrastructure that can be shared across multiple customers in exchange for a long-term contract. We are outsourcing potential revenues from what we call managed services. Advisory services for operators in noncore countries in order to help them with tower outsourcing processes. These services may include assistance during the preacquisition stage of towers supporting the transfer of assets to the new TowerCo as well as supporting further M&A plans. It is worth mentioning that these partnerships involve no equity contribution by service. 
In addition to our traditional macro tower business, we are also accessing the potential to increase our presence in the small cell area. We currently have a 8-year contract with the Barcelona municipality by which we can sell collocation services for small cells placed through the city. In this regard, and leveraging on this concept, we are pleased to announce to you that we have just reached an agreement with Orange to deploy the first small cell network in Barcelona, with the potential to add more operators in the future into this network. 
If we moved to Slide #12. We describe our experience in the areas of the small cells, IoT in small cities. As I have just mentioned it, we already have a contract with the municipality of Barcelona which grant us access to German infrastructure and public locations in order to serve collocation services for the small cells. Such agreements are of key importance as having access to premium locations in urban area, and is the key differentiating factor when deploying a small cell network. Today, we are analyzing the possibility with different MNOs to initiate nonpilot projects with the objective to shape the business model and the most feasible locations and provide high-capacity connectivity in areas of a strong data demand. I just mentioned it, we have just reached an agreement with Orange for the deployment of the first small cell network in Barcelona. 
In the area of the Internet of Things, we have deployed a national coverage network based on Sigfox technology for our customer security [indiscernible]. To date, we provide the network infrastructure, backhaul connectivity and network maintenance, but we are also analyzing the possibility to expand our presence in other areas of the value chain. 
Finally, in the area of Smart Cities, we currently manage and maintain the WiFi network of the city of Barcelona allowing us to offer innovative services to third party over this network such as WiFi mesh, it means active interconnection of access points or platform -- has a platform of offload, I mean mobile data download over WiFi networks. 
Moving to Slide #13. Let me now please in this section reminding our main highlight for 2015. We are now a public company after a very successful IPO with the market supporting our equity story based on becoming the tower consolidator in Europe. We have managed to show a continued strong performance in the Telecom Site Rental business, basic and organic growth and accretive acquisitions, while setting the foundations for future organic opportunities. By the end of 2015, we held the position #25 in terms of market capitalization of the Spanish companies. The 20th of July we successfully complete our inaugural debt capital markets transaction with a EUR 600 million bond with a 7-year maturity and a coupon of 3.125%. The bond was 6x [ph] oversubscribed and has no covenants allowing for future growth. We carry out a transformational deal less than 1 year ago by acquiring 7,377 towers from WIND in Italy. The integration process of this new company is on track and we are extremely pleased with its performance better than anticipated. We have started implementing the first stage of our efficiency program. We have paid our first dividend. The national MUX retendering process has been complete, and we are now working with our customers in order to accelerate the flow chart [ph]. Additionally, with 700 megahertz band has been allocated through TV use at least until 2026. Finally, 6 months ago, we shared our guidance with you that we have met which proved our focus on delivery. Now please allow me to hand over to José Manuel Aisa who will explain you in detail our 2015 business and financial performance. Please, Jose Manuel.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Tobías. So regarding the 2015 business performance, let me start by highlighting that we have met the guidance we shared with you 2 quarters ago and that we have managed to meet this guidance mainly because of the strong organic growth in 2015
componenttext:
Thank you, Tobías. So regarding the 2015 business performance, let me start by highlighting that we have met the guidance we shared with you 2 quarters ago and that we have managed to meet this guidance mainly because of the strong organic growth in 2015, leading, at the same time, to a cash conversion ratio of 83%. 
Moving to the next slide, 16. In terms facility, we have managed to increase the number of PoPs by 8% compared to December 2015 [ph] as to our guidance for the rollout the reduction of coverage gaps and higher network densification needs. In 2015, we have doubled the size of our tower portfolio by acquiring 300 towers from Telefonica [indiscernible] 2015 and 7,677 towers from WIND back in March. It is worth mentioning that the integration process of business company [ph] is on track and in less than 1 year of operations, we are proud of its performance, even better than we anticipated at the time of the acquisition. 
We are also paving the way for future organic growth by actively pursuing rationalization projects with mobile operators looking for a reduction of the cost spend and maintain assets. In Italia, we see a scope of around 2,000 towers to lead the commission and by working intensely to announce an agreement. This strong performance of our telecom severance agreement more than offset the temporary impact from the shutdown of TV channels back in 2013, which we expect to bring back to normalized level this year. In [indiscernible], we can confirm that the tendering [ph] process of 6 [indiscernible] deals tenders have been completed and that we have signed [indiscernible] all of the groups that have been awarded [indiscernible]. We are now working closely with our customers in order to help them switch on [indiscernible] content as soon as possible, and they are all now broadcasting in [indiscernible]. Additionally, the risk of loss of a TV channel was completely removed. All national TV content with these customers have recently [indiscernible] and the outcome of the World Radiocommunication Conference has been positive. In the network services and others, we have also seen a strong performance [indiscernible] with the extension of the complete [ph] network in the Valencia region and the communications network for the rail station in the Barcelona area. As Tobías has stated earlier, we have deployed the Internet of Things network with national companies. We are analyzing the possibility to invest in backhauling for our customers, and we are also looking into the opportunity to start trial in Barcelona in the area of the small cell. [indiscernible] we have done, and we believe we can in the short term, we keep analyzing any single opportunity we can to continue creating value for our shareholders. For example, in the refinancing process [indiscernible] achieve an efficient capital structure to continue capturing new growth opportunities. Another is our efficiency program, [indiscernible] we will go back later. And last but not least, the lean measures we have implemented in order to reshuffle our cash management. 
Turning to the next slide. You can see here the evolution of sites, PoPs and the resulting consolidating tenancy ratio with the impact of M&A activity explaining the name changes. Despite its effect, we have continued to optimize our network through decommissioning and managed to grow organically by adding tenants in the few countries where we are present. It is very important to emphasize that in the period we have increased the number of PoPs by 8% when compared to December 2014, reflecting the effectiveness of our portfolio for mobile operators. 
On Slide 18, we explain in detail the framework of the Telecom Site Rental Business in terms of revenues. And here, you can see [indiscernible] contribute EUR 8 million to our cost-related figures will as [indiscernible] at EUR 188 million in the same period. 
Moving now to adjusted EBITDA in Slide 19. You can see how the negative impact of the broadcasting business is more than offset by inorganic and organic growth in the telecom segment with the contribution of the organic growth for EUR 6 million in the year. I'm talking about the telecom segment.
Slide 20. We now focus on the adjusted EBITDA margin evolution operating leverage coming from organic growth increases our margin by 2%. Although this is definitely by the contribution, and Galata had a temporary loss of TV channels. Slide 21. Let me now spend some time explaining our recurring leverage free cash flow generation in detail. I would like to start by highlighting the recurring revenue free cash flow in 2015 have increased 28% when compared to 2014, and that we'll have managed to keep our sound cash conversion ratio at 83% even with temporary negative impact from our broadcasting business. 
Looking to revenues. Telecom Site Rental increases mainly due to the strong organic growth contribution and to recent acquisitions. In the broadcasting business, we have suffered the negative impact of the shutdown of 9 DDT channels which took place in late 2014, but this effect has partially been offset by the simulcast carried out during the first month of 2015. Please take into consideration that this is a one-off effect in the year with its associate revenues not to be seen again in 2015. Network services and other revenues shows a strong increase due to the extension of PPDR contract and [indiscernible] terminals. 
Moving now to OpEx. We have a very well-contained cost base with a flat performance on a like-for-like basis. The increase [indiscernible] is mainly due to costs already associated with our recent project decisions and incremental cost when we have [indiscernible] as a passthrough, therefore [indiscernible] on revenues. As the year progresses, we expect the businesses to start being more and more visible on our figures. On adjusted EBITDA, our adjusted EBITDA reached EUR 235 million in line with our guidance and showing a strong 32% increase when compared to last year. Our working capital change remain slightly positive thanks to our strict management, and we expect this to be the trend going forward. When compared to last year, tax paid have decreased mainly because of differentiation of different tax management measures. Maintenance CapEx have been [indiscernible] during the last quarter, breaking normalized level. Decreasing normally [indiscernible] CapEx is mainly explained by the word caveat in the cost base of the simulcast, which also translates into more revenues in the period. Our M&A investment increased due to the [indiscernible]. On shareholder remuneration, our board of directors will propose at the annual shareholder's meeting the distribution of a final dividend of EUR 0.047 per share bringing the total dividend to be distributed against 2015 results to around EUR 20 million is approved [indiscernible] our 20% of our recurring leverage free cash flow for the second half of 2015 as stated in the IPO. 
Slide 22. Moving now to our balance sheet. Cellnex leverage has increased to 3.7x net debt adjusted annualized EBITDA. Below market consensus and also below our long-term average target or forecast. The group has increased the size of the total asset by amount slightly below EUR 1 billion due to the sustaining cost of Galata. Our total equity has remained similar to 2014 with the change mainly due to the net profit in [indiscernible]. Our total work borrowings has increased by EUR 550 million in order to accomplish the already mentioned acquisition and with our balance sheet now reflecting our new capital structure and our bond issued. 
Coming back to the remaining lines of our income statement. Depreciation and amortization shares [ph] increased mainly as a result of our recent acquisitions. It is worth mentioning that we have annualized the purchase price allocation process of Galata and the figures provided are now being included [indiscernible] D&A going forward. With regard to income tax, it includes the nontax impact in deferred tax due to the change in the Italian tax rate applicable from 2017 onwards. This was attained -- carried out by the Italian government as of December 28, 2015. [indiscernible] net profit [indiscernible] EUR 48 million down when compared to last year due to the combined contribution of the FX, and I will explain. We will now focus on our capital allocation for the year, Slide 23. M&A investment has been dedicated in 2015 for the execution of Galata, and 300 towers from Telefonica. Organic expansion CapEx, which is [indiscernible] additional earnings from the asset is deploying with [indiscernible] of low teens unlevered IRR. In [indiscernible], most of this CapEx has been invested in simulcast [indiscernible] of our efficiency plan and the process of [indiscernible] in the context of our IPO. Additionally, our board has provided us with a new capital deployment tool we might use which pertain to asset acquisition, especially in stock. With do these additional levers to make the most of attractive share price and for its future use in corporate transaction thus reducing the size capital increases. 
Going now to Slide 24. As [indiscernible] in our H1 2015 results, there are several cost variance where we see room for improvement and that we constitute the basis of our current efficiency plan. The main contributor to this efficiency plan will be savings from ground leases. [indiscernible] revenue statement [indiscernible] the annual rent being paid and also extended ratio of ground lease contract. Also, advantage we have on a lump sum being paid in advance [indiscernible] lease reduction of the contract. The negative target around 5,000 sites and we believe we can extract savings of around EUR 14 million in 2019 accumulated. But there are also [indiscernible] on where we can entrust additional savings. When it comes to [indiscernible], we will focus on reducing the amount of electricity used as well as electricity fees currently being paid by negotiating with our supplier. In Italia, we are targeting a total of 800 sites with potential of OpEx reduction. We are also upgrading our [indiscernible] activity network in order to make a more efficient use of spectrum [indiscernible] that focus on the redesign of internal processes toward working efficiencies and contract renegotiation of the internal process. 
Slide 25. These first measures have started to implemented in 2015, and we will see the full benefit in 2019, with the aim to improve OpEx market consensus for next year. It is important to highlight that this plan is backloaded with a part of the savings to [indiscernible] mainly in 2018, 2019. CapEx expansion investment will fall into the [indiscernible] category. And as such, it will be deployed at a low teens unlevered IRR. As you can see on the chart, we expect an evolution of OpEx reflecting full year impact [indiscernible] inflation and any incremental OpEx gained to additional organic growth. This efficiency plan started an OpEx reduction of 5% of the 2019 OpEx result initiative. 
Moving to Slide 26. In terms of the financial outlook for 2016, we believe we can provide a recurring levered free cash flow at least 10% higher than in 2015 and in line with our market expectations. Looking at the December division [ph] line, it is important to highlight that 88% of our revenues for 2015 are already fully contracted. We expect adjusted EBITDA to grow around to the high teen mark and the rest of the line can we project according to our already effective [indiscernible]. A special mention to cash tax [indiscernible] to 2015 this time, a higher income in 2016. Now let me please hand over to Tobías for the final remarks. Thanks, Tobías.

componenttext: Okay. Thank you, Henrik. This is [indiscernible], business development director. I will answer the first part of your question which is in relation to the, let's say, the potential recommissioning plans as also Jose Manuel and Tobias mentioned during their results today. We are in advanced discussions here. We have several versions ongoing and in -- not only in Spain but also in Italy. And as you know, we are accustomed to 2 types of model business models. One is [indiscernible], which is the monetization of assets to that one operator maybe, let's say, interested in selling. The other one is more on the rationalization and this aspect that takes some time on finding [indiscernible], so we need to go into the detailed analysis of side-by-side, taking the decision with 1 of the 2 potential sites the recommission is going to survive at the end. [indiscernible] to do an analysis in relation to not only the cost of the lease but also for instance the fiber access. So in some cases, there is often interest to move the fiber if the [indiscernible] is cheaper or the other way around if the fiber is present, we may choose the [indiscernible] with the fiber. That takes some time but also takes some, let's say, discussions with the MNOs and the retail analysis on which are the activities that have to be performed by the MNO or by ourself especially on the moving of the equipment. So all those discussions are quite advanced. We have detail, let's say, identified bunch of portfolios, as I said, with several operators in both countries [indiscernible], and would take some time but work is absolutely in progress.

And also on top of that, in the current market and talking about bond -- say talking about debt market, we're going to be consistent with our long term 4x net debt-to-EBITDA that we have explained, happy to go to EBIT that could be maybe 6.5x net debt-to-EBITDA, but always being commensurate with the current market situation. At the end of the day, we will try to a protect the group [ph] a fully financed package that is comfort. We're not in a hurry to execute our bond issuance through a secured right issue [indiscernible] whatever has been we may have. We have time. We have the back of our bank. And also we'll try to reap confidence in the market in terms of financing.

This is an initiative of Cellnex taking into consideration the requirements from our customers and the technical requirements of the new technologies like 4G. So this is, I think, win-win scenario and opportunity to bring these new services in our existing towers. So this is the reason why we could secure the last mile of connectivity from point of service from this point of service of optical fiber to our towers. componenttext: Final agreement because it is very [indiscernible] today along side with the [indiscernible] and the municipality of Barcelona. It is leveraging on the contract that has been affirmation of earlier contract that we have with the municipality where we have access of core telecom purposes to their municipal furniture like alarms and traffic lights. We are experimenting with, let's say, branch, the rollout of several cells on the most dense -- the same dense of traffic areas of Barcelona. We've a system that is intended to be, let's say, be permanent. So it's a bit more than high low cost as expected. And here, let's say, interestingly, we are working on the different positions where we at markers could be either advertising, let's say, billboards or lamps, the heights and call the height affects? Synchronization with macro cells. So we believe that there is some strong interest from Orange in particular on going back on that area and being able to renew the different frequencies they have. As you know, the MNOs are different, lot of frequencies and specifically in that case 2.6GHz is going to be used. Other MNOs are also having interest on that and there are deferral, let's say, layers of involvement up to the point that potentially share active agreement. In the case of Orange, we provide the optical network, access to the infrastructure and power supply and help them on the engineering and design.

componenttextpreview: Well, today, from your first question about Yoigo. Today, Yoigo is a relevant customer of Cellnex in the in Spain. Today, we have 2,500 point of presence with Yoigo. And as you can imagine, if Yoigo want to rollout a new 4G network, we will be there. I wi
componenttext: Well, today, from your first question about Yoigo. Today, Yoigo is a relevant customer of Cellnex in the in Spain. Today, we have 2,500 point of presence with Yoigo. And as you can imagine, if Yoigo want to rollout a new 4G network, we will be there. I will know in which size or what will be the final approach. But I cannot tell you anything else, because this is a very sensitive information from our customer. But of course, it could be a potential opportunity if this project will happen. On your question about the Slide # -- Page #7, well, for us make sense to reach agreements with local partners if they're all will be componential. I mean, like we get to or we are not some investors. As you know, we have the clear role. We have clear strategy over Europe. But it doesn't mean that to get local partners is a must. But because if you look back on our Galata transaction, we didn't get any kind of partner. But when we approach Inwit, as you can imagine, if you got Galata and on top of that Inwit, it will count more than 50% of our current business. So there is reason why we thought that it makes sense to approach as to look for a local partner and F2i fits very well with us.

componenttextpreview: Well, from our point of view, the consolidation for us make more sense in the name of Inwit. I mean, Inwit is the [indiscernible] that fits 100% with us, make a lot of sense in terms of synergies. Because for us, Italy is not project, it is a real operati
componenttext: Well, from our point of view, the consolidation for us make more sense in the name of Inwit. I mean, Inwit is the [indiscernible] that fits 100% with us, make a lot of sense in terms of synergies. Because for us, Italy is not project, it is a real operation. We have delivered 1/3 of our revenues and we have 50% of our assets in Italy and we have the national coverage network. So this is the reason why we are at -- well, the consolidation between Wind and Hutch maybe is a fact in the whole Europe, in every country. Consolidation will happen in every country. But for us in terms of interested choice, it's attractive to approach in the meaning of telecom infrastructure companies like Inwit.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Well, it's really difficult to reply to the first question because it is a very sensitive information regarding the offers. But as we are aware, at least for the press, if you true taking into consideration that we have no information -- official in
componenttext: Okay. Well, it's really difficult to reply to the first question because it is a very sensitive information regarding the offers. But as we are aware, at least for the press, if you true taking into consideration that we have no information -- official information for other offers, if you're true that other are submitting 29.9%, first of all, that I want to remark that, well, I believe the process letter from TI was very clear, at least 45% of the stake. Stake hold remarks that I want to underline is that if you submit below 30% minority shareholders of Inwit will be out of this transaction. And third one is that Cellnex is an investor [indiscernible] and our DNA is to manage the whole [indiscernible] to manage the company [indiscernible] introduce, release and to take the responsibility in front of our shareholders of this project. So this is the reason why for us it doesn't make sense to be 30% or 29.9%. Second question, our project in Europe, it's not Spain, it's not Italy. For sure, Italy and Spain today are our first priority. I'm not telling you that, for us, it's the same company without or with Inwit, but we have other opportunities in our pipeline for sure. But we want to prioritize today our opportunities and for sure Italy and Spain consolidation are our first priority and this is the reason why Inwit make a lot of sense in the next weeks. But for sure, if we don't succeed Inwit, we will proceed with other opportunities that we have in our pipeline.

And the scope of Europe, if I'm not wrong, maybe overlapping with the perimeter of this company will be in Spain, but our scope is whole Europe. componenttext: Yes. Looking to your third question. In the 700 MHz band, we do not foresee any impact in the number of multiples here. The reason replanning and everything has mostly take that into account and we do not see any impact. Below 700 that would knew from the recent ITU congress last November in Geneva, is that this is also protected until 2020. So in that sense, 20-20, so in that sense -- 20% stake -- in that sense, we also feel that the processing business is pretty well secured.

componenttext: I have 2 questions. The first question is to do with tax. I noticed that you've -- I believe it has a rule or law in Italy that allows you to convert goodwill into tax deductions. Have you already capitalized on that? And then secondly, if there is similar any similar opportunities in Spain? And then my second question, I think in the third quarter, you mentioned the framework agreement with a mobile broadband operator for around 1,500 sites, can you just give us an update on that contract or that arrangement?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, Jon [indiscernible] follow very well and the tax [indiscernible] evolution of that make sense and it is this goodwill change of law took place in Italy as of September 28, 2015. And finally, it seems possible to depreciate a goodwill from 10 years t
componenttext: Well, Jon [indiscernible] follow very well and the tax [indiscernible] evolution of that make sense and it is this goodwill change of law took place in Italy as of September 28, 2015. And finally, it seems possible to depreciate a goodwill from 10 years to 5 years. The thing is that in order to depreciate this good will for tax purposes in 5 year's time, you need to say up front 16% of the goodwill. And then you can somehow get back, let's say, the corporate tax income of the company multiply by the goodwill 4 or 5 years [indiscernible] divided by 5 for 5 years. So this is something that can take place as long as there is a measure and as long that is goodwill counts us in the balance sheet of the company. So it cannot be a cost-related goodwill, it has to be a goodwill that appear in the financial audited statements of the company. And in order to show, as you know, you have to match the target and the [indiscernible.  And this is something that is mainly it depends on the structure maybe that didn't happen. So this is the first caveat. And the second caveat is -- the second caveat I would say to you regarding the goodwill is you have to pay upfront as we said. And finally, you have to do a CPO exercise, [indiscernible] allocation in which you say how much of this goodwill has to be allocated to assets and the cost [indiscernible] and how much of the goodwill can be retain as goodwill [indiscernible]. So Jon, there are the low risk and there are free limitation and it's not easy to fulfill all of them. You can't take for granted that in which finally, as per the company we will have accept this in detail, we are [indiscernible] in detail but it's not easy to implement. And second, the question is.
