headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by Tobías Martinez, CEO of Cellnex; with José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, who will lead today's presentation. I would like to th
componenttext: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by Tobías Martinez, CEO of Cellnex; with José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, who will lead today's presentation. I would like to thank you all for joining us today for Cellnex 2015 Full Year Results Conference Call. We have, earlier today, posted a presentation, which we will refer to throughout our prepared remarks under the Investor Relations section on our website. And then we'll open the line for a Q&A session. Now I hand over to Tobías Martinez. Please, Tobías.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Juan Jose. Good afternoon, everyone. Thank you so very much for your time today and please allow me to start by highlighting that we are very proud to present again a solid set of results, with all of our projects progressing steadily and our c
componenttext:
Thank you, Juan Jose. Good afternoon, everyone. Thank you so very much for your time today and please allow me to start by highlighting that we are very proud to present again a solid set of results, with all of our projects progressing steadily and our core activities delivering a continued strong organic growth with sustained demand seen for our portfolio of assets and services. 
If we move to Slide #4, I would like to start by highlighting that 2015 has been a year of deliveries. We have met the guidance we shared with you, and we have done so supporting our activity in our 3 strategic pillars. The first one is the organic growth. Organic growth means maximization of our existing portfolio to capture new revenues while efficiently managing our cost structure, hence delivering an attractive operating leverage. The second one is to keep a robust balance sheet with flexible access to debt and capital markets. The objective is to have a stable long-term balance sheet and a competitive cost, while retaining the financing flexibility required to capture new growth opportunities. And the third one, we are willing to play a key role in the consolidation of the tower landscape in Europe. In this sense, I would like to emphasize that our geographical focus is Europe. But our [indiscernible] have been better than nature allows us to reaching a long-term partner for our customers. And that's the only reason why we will execute a transaction is because we will create value for our stockholders. And to ensure this is the case, we have a strict investment discipline. 
We move to Slide #5. We can approach the specific examples that illustrate our strategic pillars. Organic growth in the Telecom Site Rental business has been strong in 2015 with an increase of PoPs of 8% mainly due to our multi-tenancy services. That means more customers on our towers because they require additional locations mainly for a 4G rollout. Reduction of coverage gaps and higher densification mainly in the urban areas. It is also important to mention that after just 9 months of operations in Italy, the company that runs the towers we acquired from WIND in Italy, we have managed it to increase our tenancy ratio in the country. Thus, meeting our acquisition business plan so far. I think this is a very good news for everyone. 
Looking into 2016 onwards, we believe the main driver for organic growth will be the rationalization of our rapid [ph] networks. And in order to capture this growth, we have today identified around 2,000 towers that can be dismantled in the 2 countries we are present. We are actively and constantly working with different operators and we expect to present to you good news on this front in the very short term. The economical benefits of this new activity should start being visible from 2016, 2017. Moving to Slide #6. Here, you can see the main characteristics of our current debt structure. As a result of the refinancing process we carried out last year, we have managed to extend our maturities at a competitive cost, removed any additional covenants which might constrain our future growth, partially hedge our interest rates and diversify our sources of funds. This creates the appropriate platform to continue pursuing and manage projects, which are analyzed under strict value-creation criteria with a view to maximize levered free cash flow per share, while minimizing the need for capital increases. With this capital structure in place, we will face no refinancing risk for the next 6 years as the first maturity in 2020 can be easily repaid with the cash generated by the group during this period. Our leverage stands today at EUR 927 million with the leverage ratio of 3.7x net debt EBITDA. 
Moving to Slide #7. This is just to remind you of the excellent M&A execution we have carried out during the last 4 years with an average acquisition of 3,000 towers per year and which has allowed us to grow at the low mid-teens CAGR in terms of adjusted EBITDA and recurring levered free cash flow. And what's the next? Our first priority is to consolidate our presence in Spain and in Italy, and then we want to continue pursuing new projects in the main European countries like U.K., France and Germany. And these countries offer very attractive market dynamics and interesting opportunities that we are currently assessing. I would now like to hand over to José Manuel Aisa, our CFO, who will provide you more details on this front.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Tobías. I would like to take this opportunity to update on the current status of our potential acquisition of Inwit. As you all know, we have submitted, along with the Italian fund F2i, a nonbinding offer for a stake in Inwit that would trigge
componenttext: Thank you, Tobías. I would like to take this opportunity to update on the current status of our potential acquisition of Inwit. As you all know, we have submitted, along with the Italian fund F2i, a nonbinding offer for a stake in Inwit that would trigger a mandatory tender of 100% of the company. We are today working on the second stage of the process and expect to submit our binding offer by mid-March. It is worth mentioning the importance in these kinds of projects of engaging a strategic local partner to capitalize an important no less financial standing of the project's framework. Our nature is that of an industrial player. We need to control the assets we acquire in order to achieve full synergy and [indiscernible] to become a long-term partner of our client and to provide additional services in the future. The financing [indiscernible] has already been approved by several leading financial institutions and covers the total value of the target. Finally, this transaction and any other we make in the future will only be carried out if we meet our strict investment criteria. First, at least 10% equity IRR on a project standalone basis. Second, recurring levered free cash flow per share accretion from year 2, 3 onwards and on a consolidated basis. And finally, an increased delevering capacity post acquisition when compared to the previous situation. So Tobías, I think, is -- will have...

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Let's move to Slide #9. And this is again to remind you that we have met the guidance we shared with you back in August and that is -- constitutes an excellent starting point to meet 2016 market expectations. We have posted an adjusted EBITDA in lin
componenttext:
Okay. Let's move to Slide #9. And this is again to remind you that we have met the guidance we shared with you back in August and that is -- constitutes an excellent starting point to meet 2016 market expectations. We have posted an adjusted EBITDA in line with market expectations, maintenance CapEx has been slightly below, working capital change is slightly positive thanks to our proactive management, interest payments have been very well contained and cash tax has been in line with what we anticipated. All this leads to a net debt position as of end of the year below market expectations. 
If we move to Slide #10, this strong delivery has also been recognized by the market during 2015, with Cellnex share price up to 23% when compared to our IPO price of EUR 14 per share and a 38% outperformance when compared to the IBEX index. Our share price has recently experienced a high degree of volatility, but our fundamentals remain equally strong and market estimates have been maintained, providing a target price of around EUR 18 per share with an upside potential of 27%. 
Moving to Slide #11. It is important to make emphasis again on our ability to extend the array of services we can provide over our current asset base and with our available resources. As already discussed, 2015 has been a year when multi-tenancy has provide us with a very strong organic growth and 2016 will be a year when rationalization projects will play a key role. But we are also actively monitoring and analyzing new potential business lines, which may provide us with future revenue streams. Built to suit is an area where we will use an opportunistic approach. Today, we already have an agreement with WIND in Italy to build 400 towers over 6 years. In 2014, we entered into an agreement with Securitas Direct for the deployment of the first global IoT network with national coverage in Spain. We are now looking at expanding this network by adding new locations. A field where we also see an opportunity is backhauling, which consists of acquiring the right of use of existing fiber-to-the-tower or the deployment of new fiber where such an alternative is not available. This will represent a way to increase the effectiveness of our portfolio, as we will be able to offer high-speed connectivity, thus avoiding future capacity bottlenecks if the data demand continues rising at the current rates. And the economics are similar to our core business. CapEx is deployed on an infrastructure that can be shared across multiple customers in exchange for a long-term contract. We are outsourcing potential revenues from what we call managed services. Advisory services for operators in noncore countries in order to help them with tower outsourcing processes. These services may include assistance during the preacquisition stage of towers supporting the transfer of assets to the new TowerCo as well as supporting further M&A plans. It is worth mentioning that these partnerships involve no equity contribution by Cellnex.
In addition to our traditional macro tower business, we are also assessing the potential to increase our presence in the small cell area. We currently have a 8-year contract with the Barcelona municipality by which we can sell co-location services for small cells placed through the city. In this regard, and leveraging on this contract, we are pleased to announce to you that we have just reached an agreement with Orange to deploy the first small cell network in Barcelona, with the potential to add more operators in the future into this network. 
If we move to Slide #12, we describe our experience in the areas of the small cells, IoT and Smart Cities. As I have just mentioned, we already have a contract with the municipality of Barcelona, which grants us access to urban infrastructure and public locations in order to serve co-location services for the small cells. Such agreements are of key importance of having access to premium locations in urban areas, and is the key differentiating factor when deploying a small cell network. Today, we are analyzing the possibility with different MNOs to initiate some pilot projects with the objective to shape the business model, find the most feasible locations and provide high-capacity connectivity in areas of strong data demand. I just mentioned it, we have just reached an agreement with Orange for the deployment of the first small cell network in Barcelona. 
In the area of the Internet of Things, we have deployed a national coverage network based on Sigfox technology for our customer security [ph] [indiscernible]. To date, we provide the network infrastructure, backhaul connectivity and network maintenance, but we are also analyzing the possibility to expand our presence in other areas of the value chain. 
Finally, in the area of Smart Cities, we currently manage and maintain the WiFi network of the city of Barcelona, allowing us to offer innovative services to third party over this network such as WiFi mesh, it means active interconnection of access points or platform -- has a platform of offload, I mean mobile data download over WiFi networks. 
Moving to Slide #13. Let me now please in this section reminding our main highlight for 2015. We are now a public company after a very successful IPO with the market supporting our equity story based on becoming the tower consolidator in Europe. We have managed to show a continued strong performance in the Telecom Site Rental business, based on organic growth and accretive acquisitions, while setting the foundations for future organic opportunities. By the end of 2015, we held the position #25 in terms of market capitalization of the Spanish companies. The 20th of July we successfully complete our inaugural debt capital markets transaction with a EUR 600 million bond with a 7-year maturity and a coupon of 3.125%. The bond was 6x oversubscribed and has no covenants, allowing for future growth. We carried out a transformational deal less than 1 year ago by acquiring 7,377 towers from WIND in Italy. The integration process of this new company is on track, and we are extremely pleased with its performance, better than anticipated. We have started implementing the first stage of our efficiency program. We have paid our first dividend. The national MUX retendering process has been complete, and we are now working with our [indiscernible] customers in order to accelerate the future [ph]. Additionally, the 700 megahertz band has been allocated through TV use at least until 2026. Finally, 6 months ago, we shared our guidance with you that we have met which proved our focus on delivery. Now please allow me to hand over to José Manuel Aisa, who will explain you in detail our 2015 business and financial performance. Please, Jose Manuel.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Tobías. So regarding the 2015 business performance, let me start by highlighting that we have met the guidance we shared with you 2 quarters ago and that we have managed to meet this guidance mainly because of the strong organic growth in 2015
componenttext:
Thank you, Tobías. So regarding the 2015 business performance, let me start by highlighting that we have met the guidance we shared with you 2 quarters ago and that we have managed to meet this guidance mainly because of the strong organic growth in 2015, leading, at the same time, to a cash conversion ratio of 83%. 
Moving to the next slide, 16. In terms facility, we have managed to increase the number of PoPs by 8% compared to December 2015 [ph] as to our guidance for the rollout, the reduction of coverage gaps and higher network densification needs. In 2015, we have doubled the size of our tower portfolio by acquiring 300 towers from Telefonica [indiscernible] 2015 and 7,677 towers from WIND back in March. It is worth mentioning that the integration process of each  company [ph] is on track and in less than 1 year of operations, we are proud of its performance, even better than we anticipated at the time of the acquisition. 
We are also paving the way for future organic growth by actively pursuing rationalization projects with mobile operators looking for a reduction of the cost spend and maintain assets. In Italia, we see a scope of around 2,000 towers to decommission and by working intensely to announce an agreement. This strong performance of our telecom severance agreement more than offset the temporary impact from the shutdown of TV channels back in 2013, which we expect to bring back to normalized levels this year. In this regard, we can confirm that the tendering process of 6 new TV channels has been completed and that we have signed contracts with all of the groups that have been awarded [indiscernible]. We are now working closely with our customers in order to help them switch on [indiscernible] content as soon as possible, and they are all now broadcasting in [indiscernible]. Additionally, the risk of loss of 8 TV channels was completely removed. All national DDT content with these customers has recently been renewed and the outcome of the World Radiocommunication Conference has been positive. In the network services and other areas, we have also seen a strong performance [indiscernible] with the extension of the complete [ph] network in the Valencia region and the communications network for the rail station in the Barcelona area. As Tobías has stated earlier, we have deployed the Internet of Things network with national coverage [ph]. We are analyzing the possibility to invest in backhauling for our customers, and we are also looking into the possibility to start trials in Barcelona in the area of the small cell. [indiscernible] we have done, and where we believe we can assist in the short term, we keep analyzing any single opportunity we can find to continue creating value for our shareholders. For example, in the refinancing process [indiscernible] achieve an efficient capital structure to continue capturing new growth opportunities. Another is our efficiency program, details of which we will cover later. And last but not least, the lean [ph] measures we have implemented in order to reshuffle our tax management. 
Turning to the next slide. You can see here the evolution of sites, PoPs and the resulting consolidating tenancy ratio with the impact of M&A activity explaining the name changes. Despite its effect, we have continued to optimize our network through decommissioning and managed to grow organically by adding tenants in the few countries where we are present. It is very important to emphasize that in the period we have increased the number of PoPs by 8% when compared to December 2014, reflecting the effectiveness of our portfolio for mobile operators. 
On Slide 18, we explain in detail the framework of the Telecom Site Rental Business in terms of revenues. And here, you can see [indiscernible] contribute EUR 8 million to our cost-related figures will as [indiscernible] at EUR 188 million in the same period. 
Moving now to adjusted EBITDA in Slide 19. You can see how the negative impact of the broadcasting business is more than offset by inorganic and organic growth in the Telecom Site Rental business with the contribution of the organic growth for EUR 6 million in the year. I'm talking about the telecom segment.
Slide 20. We now focus on the adjusted EBITDA margin evolution, operating leverage coming from organic growth increases our margin by 2%. Although this is diluted by the contribution and Galata had a temporary loss of TV channels. Slide 21. Let me now spend some time explaining our recurring levered free cash flow generation in detail. I would like to start by highlighting the recurring levered free cash flow in 2015 has increased 28% when compared to 2014, and that we have managed to keep our sound cash conversion ratio at 83% even with temporary negative impact from our broadcasting business. 
Looking to revenues. Telecom Site Rental increases mainly due to the strong organic growth contribution and to recent acquisitions. In the broadcasting business, we have suffered the negative impact of the shutdown of 9 DDT channels which took place in late 2014, but this effect has partially been offset by the simulcast carried out during the first month of 2015. Please take into consideration that this is a one-off effect in the year with its associated revenues not to be seen again in 2016. Network services and other revenues show a strong increase due to the extension of PPDR contract and [indiscernible] terminals. 
Moving now to OpEx. We have a very well-contained cost base with a flat performance on a like-for-like basis. The increase [indiscernible] is mainly due to costs already associated with our recent project decisions and incremental cost when we have [indiscernible] as a pass-through, therefore [indiscernible] on revenues. As the year progresses, we expect efficiencies to start being more and more visible in our figures. On adjusted EBITDA, our adjusted EBITDA reached EUR 235 million in line with our guidance and showing a strong 32% increase when compared to last year. Our working capital change remains slightly positive thanks to our strict management, and we expect this to be the trend going forward. When compared to last year, tax paid has decreased mainly because of implementation of different tax management measures. Maintenance CapEx have been [indiscernible] during the last quarter, reaching normalized level. Decreasing normalized [indiscernible] CapEx is mainly explained by the work carried out in the cost base of the simulcast, which also translates into more revenues in the period. Our M&A investment increased due to the [indiscernible]. On shareholder remuneration, our Board of Directors will propose at the annual shareholder's meeting the distribution of a final dividend of EUR 0.047 per share bringing the total dividend to be distributed against 2015 results to around EUR 20 million if approved, or in other words, 20% of our recurring levered free cash flow for the second half of 2015 as stated in the IPO. 
Slide 22. Moving now to our balance sheet. Cellnex leverage has increased to 3.7x net debt adjusted annualized EBITDA. Below market consensus and also below our long-term average target or forecast. The group has increased the size of its total assets by amount slightly below EUR 1 billion due to the sustaining [ph] cost of Galata. Our total equity has remained similar to 2014 with the change mainly due to the net profit generated in the year. Our total work borrowings has increased by EUR 550 million in order to accomplish the already mentioned acquisition and with our balance sheet now reflecting our new capital structure and our bond issued. 
Coming back to the remaining lines of our income statement. Depreciation and amortization shares [ph] increased mainly as a result of our recent acquisitions. It is worth mentioning that we have annualized the purchase price allocation process of Galata and the figures provided are now being included [indiscernible] D&A going forward. With regard to income tax, it includes the nontax impact in deferred tax due to the change in the Italian tax rate applicable from 2017 onwards. This was attained -- carried out by the Italian government as of December 28, 2015. Cellnex net profit reached EUR 48 million down when compared to last year due to the combined contribution of the FX, and I will explain. We will now focus on our capital allocation for the year, Slide 23. M&A investment has been dedicated in 2015 for the execution of Galata, and 300 towers from Telefonica. Organic expansion CapEx, which is [indiscernible] additional earnings from the asset is deploying with [indiscernible] of low teens unlevered IRR. In [indiscernible], most of this CapEx has been invested in simulcast [indiscernible] of our efficiency plan and the process of [indiscernible] in the context of our IPO. Additionally, our board has provided us with a new capital deployment tool we might use, with the potential acquisition, especially in stock. We will use these additional levers to make the most of attractive share price and for its future use in corporate transaction, thus reducing the size capital increases. 
Going now to Slide 24. As [indiscernible] in our H1 2015 results, there are several cost areas where we see room for improvement and that will constitute the basis of our current efficiency plan. The main contributor to this efficiency plan will be savings from ground leases. [indiscernible] revenue statement [indiscernible] the annual rent being paid and also extended duration of ground lease contract. Also, advantage we have on a lump sum being paid in advance in exchange for a lease reduction [indiscernible] of the contract. The negative [ph] target around 5,000 sites and we believe we can extract savings of around EUR 14 million in 2019 accumulated. But there are also other ideas on where we can extract additional savings. When it comes to energy, we will focus on reducing the amount of electricity used as well as electricity fees currently being paid by negotiating with our supplier. In Italia, we are targeting a total of 800 sites with potential of OpEx reduction. We are also upgrading our [indiscernible] activity network in order to make a more efficient use of spectrum [indiscernible] that focus on the redesign of internal processes toward working efficiencies and contract renegotiation to meet our targets. 
Slide 25. These first measures have started to be implemented in 2015, and we will see the full benefit in 2019, with the aim to improve OpEx market consensus for that year. It is important to highlight that this plan is back-loaded with a part of the savings to be seen mainly in 2018, 2019. CapEx expansion investment will fall into the [indiscernible] category. And as such, it will be deployed at a low teens unlevered IRR. As you can see on the chart, we expect an evolution of OpEx reflecting full year impact [indiscernible] inflation and any incremental OpEx linked to additional organic growth. This efficiency plan started an OpEx reduction of 5% of the 2019 OpEx result initiative. 
Moving to Slide 26. In terms of the financial outlook for 2016, we believe we can provide a recurring levered free cash flow at least 10% higher than in 2015 and in line with the market expectations. Looking at the December division [ph] line, it is important to highlight that 88% of our revenues for 2015 are already fully contracted. We expect adjusted EBITDA to grow around to the high teen mark and the rest of the line can we project according to our already effective [indiscernible]. A special mention to cash tax [indiscernible] to 2015 this time, a higher income in 2016. Now let me please hand over to Tobías for the final remarks. Thanks, Tobías.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Jose Manuel. Well, let me please end this presentation first saying thank you for your time and for your interest. And finally, reminding that this year, we have managed to show a very organic growth. We have changed our capital structure allow
componenttext: Thank you, Jose Manuel. Well, let me please end this presentation first saying thank you for your time and for your interest. And finally, reminding that this year, we have managed to show a very organic growth. We have changed our capital structure allowing for future growth. We have successfully carried out a transformational deal and integrated a new company, Galata, with a performance which is in line with our business plan, and that we have met the guidance we provide, which proves our focus on delivery. And with this, only I would like to open the lines to answer your questions.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016

componenttext: Next question comes from Henrik Herbst from Crédit Suisse.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: I have 2 questions. The first one is on the 2,000 sites you've been talking about for a couple of quarters now and the efficiency around that. But just wondering, it seems to have kind of been delayed slightly. And then if you could just kind of explain a
componenttext: I have 2 questions. The first one is on the 2,000 sites you've been talking about for a couple of quarters now and the efficiency around that. But just wondering, it seems to have kind of been delayed slightly. And then if you could just kind of explain a little bit what the difficulty has been when you've been renegotiating around this? And once you kind of found the model that works, I guess this is one of the first deals of this kind in Europe and if you think once you've found a solution if that's kind of applicable on other areas and next year could be a little bit smoother? And then the second question was around the financing of -- your update on the [indiscernible]. You're saying that you've got long-term financing improved covering the total target value. Does that mean we should kind of rule out that you would potentially do a rights issue to finance part of the potential deal? Actually as well on that, you've talked about 6.5x, I think, the maximum net debt you would go to [ph] given what's been going in the debt market. Is that still kind of your thinking or has that changed?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Thank you, Henrik. This is Alex Mestre, Business Development Director. I will answer the first part of your question which is in relation to the, let's say, the potential decommissioning plans as also Jose Manuel and Tobias mentioned during this cal
componenttext: Okay. Thank you, Henrik. This is Alex Mestre, Business Development Director. I will answer the first part of your question which is in relation to the, let's say, the potential decommissioning plans as also Jose Manuel and Tobias mentioned during this call today. We are in advanced discussions here. We have several versions ongoing and in -- not only in Spain but also in Italy. And as you know, we are approaching to 2 types of business models. One is [indiscernible], which is the monetization of assets, that one operator may be, let's say, interested in selling. The other one is more on the rationalization and this aspect that takes some time on finding [indiscernible], so we need to go into the detailed analysis of side-by-side, taking the decision which 1 of the 2 potential sites to be decommissioned is going to survive at the end. [indiscernible] to do an analysis in relation to not only the cost of the lease but also for instance the fiber access. So in some cases, there is often interest to move the fiber if the [indiscernible] is cheaper or the other way around if the fiber is present, we may choose the [indiscernible] with the fiber. That takes some time but also takes some, let's say, discussions with the MNOs and the detailed analysis on which are the activities that have to be performed by the MNO or by ourselves especially on the moving of the equipment. So all those discussions are quite advanced. We have detail, let's say, identified bunch of portfolios, as I said, with several operators in both countries, Spain and Italy, and that will take some time but work is absolutely in progress.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Regarding the question around the rights issue. We have now approved that is a different structure that we [indiscernible]. So rights issue, obviously, is something that we may execute in this transaction, but we will -- we are not forced to secure this a
componenttext: Regarding the question around the rights issue. We have now approved that is a different structure that we [indiscernible]. So rights issue, obviously, is something that we may execute in this transaction, but we will -- we are not forced to secure this at the beginning of the transaction or very early. I think we will have enough [indiscernible] if necessary to execute in the right momentum -- in the right moment for the market, being aware of how the market is and being commensurate with the situation of our balance sheet. So taking account [ph] that the financing of the structure is based also in our analysis. We're talking about [indiscernible]. As you know, that -- Telecom Italia is not selling its full estate, so I think that funding of the transaction is not only a question of rights issue or debt coming from that, I think that has to support us in everything [indiscernible] of the financing structure and then, obviously, to be able to minimize the rights issue, and at the same time to find the right momentum specifically. And also on top of that, in the current market and talking about bonds -- say talking about debt market, we're going to be consistent with our long term 4x net debt-to-EBITDA as we have explained, happy to go to a peak that could be maybe 6.5x net debt-to-EBITDA, but always being commensurate with the current market situation. So if the market is tougher, as it seems it is this year, maybe the 6.5x net debt-to-EBITDA is something we'll have to be prudent. Okay, maybe [indiscernible] slightly smaller can be more achievable. At the end of the day, we will try to present to you a fully financed package that seeks comfort [ph]. We're not in a hurry to execute a bond issuance or to execute a rights issue [indiscernible] whatever things we may have. We have time. We have the back of our bank. And also we'll try to reap [ph] confidence in the market in terms of financing.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thanks very much. Can I just follow up on the first question in terms of the rationalization of portfolio. It sounds like there's a lot of moving parts, just because you find a good solution for the [indiscernible] looking at now doesn't mean you have a b
componenttext: Thanks very much. Can I just follow up on the first question in terms of the rationalization of portfolio. It sounds like there's a lot of moving parts, just because you find a good solution for the [indiscernible] looking at now doesn't mean you have a blueprint for kind of the next step, is that how it should -- and each time there will be quite a lot of steps [ph] just to take into account and quite complicated negotiations. Did I get that right?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: No. I think it is quite a blueprint kind of process. We know what has to be -- let's say, taken into account, at least one of the projects, and it is a matter to decide which activities are by the MNO and which activities are by us. But I think our balanc
componenttext: No. I think it is quite a blueprint kind of process. We know what has to be -- let's say, taken into account, at least one of the projects, and it is a matter to decide which activities are by the MNO and which activities are by us. But I think our balanced cooperation is quite a step forward. It is more an engineering analysis that has to be performed in order to identify which are final sites to be decommissioned and which ones are to survive, as I said. But it is not, let's say, a [indiscernible] every time each one of the projects to go through all the different details. No, no, it's more straightforward in terms of knowing clearly what has to be done.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016

componenttext: Next question comes from Luigi Minerva from HSBC.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: I have 3, if I may. Well, the first 3 on the Inwit and the structure of your partnership with F2i. Should we assume a 50-50 contribution or maybe 60-40, with you having a higher contribution, if you can give us some guidance there. And secondly, I'm inter
componenttext: I have 3, if I may. Well, the first 3 on the Inwit and the structure of your partnership with F2i. Should we assume a 50-50 contribution or maybe 60-40, with you having a higher contribution, if you can give us some guidance there. And secondly, I'm interested in the level of the debate with the mobile operators. So now, we're talking about also backhauling opportunity. So traditionally towers backhauls have been considered strategic. I'm just wondering how do you engage with them and if you see they are more receptive of the idea that ownership of this infrastructure is not necessarily relevant over the medium term for the mobile operators. And finally, I mean, should be done about this massive project in Barcelona with Orange. On paper, it looks like a great opportunity, but I'm just wondering about the economics. Is there anything you can share with us already at this stage?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Maybe transfer your questions about as to why we'll get minority shareholder stake because we have the duty to manage the process, the project and we have to integrate in our structure with a fit in Italy. So I think that's why it fits very well. We have
componenttext: Maybe transfer your questions about as to why we'll get minority shareholder stake because we have the duty to manage the process, the project and we have to integrate in our structure with a fit in Italy. So I think that's why it fits very well. We have -- it is very confidential [indiscernible]. The final stake is not really defined, but a minority stake. When we talk about the new services like the backhaul, we're talking about connect our existing portfolio of assets, connecting the optical fiber to the tower. This is an initiative of Cellnex, taking into consideration the requirements from our customers and the technical requirements of the new technologies like 4G. So this is, I think, win-win scenario and opportunity to bring these new services in our existing towers. So this is the reason why we could execute the last mile of connectivity from point of service -- from this point of service of optical fiber to our towers. We think that it is an added value on top of our existing towers. And regarding the small cells, maybe Alex knows better than me.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Resolution. I think we are issuing a press release today alongside with Orange and the municipality of Barcelona. It is leveraging on the contract that has been affirmation of earlier contracts that we have with the municipality where we have access of --
componenttext: Resolution. I think we are issuing a press release today alongside with Orange and the municipality of Barcelona. It is leveraging on the contract that has been affirmation of earlier contracts that we have with the municipality where we have access of -- for telecom purposes to the municipal furniture like alarms and traffic lights. We are experimenting with, let's say, Orange, the roll out of several cells on the most dense -- let's say in terms of traffic areas of Barcelona. We've a system that is intended to be, let's say, be permanent. So it's a bit more than high low cost [ph] as expected. And here, let's say, interestingly, we are working on the different positions where the small cells could be, either in advertising, let's say, billboards or lamps, the height and how the height affects? Synchronization with macro cells. So we believe that there is some strong interest from Orange in particular on going fast on that area and being able to reuse the different frequencies they have. As you know, the MNOs have different, lots of frequencies and specifically in that case 2.6GHz is going to be used. Other MNOs are also having interest on that and there are different, let's say, layers of involvement up to the point that potentially share active equipment. In the case of Orange, we provide the optical network, access to the infrastructure and power supply and help them on the engineering and design.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: So in terms of the economics, should we assume lump sum for a given city and with a certain profitability or certain margin? How should we think about it?
componenttext: So in terms of the economics, should we assume lump sum for a given city and with a certain profitability or certain margin? How should we think about it?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, in terms of economics, it is something that being, let's say, the landlord, let me put it like that, the municipality, some of the terms that -- are in the process to be discussed yet with the municipality. So -- but I think in some logical sense fr
componenttext: Well, in terms of economics, it is something that being, let's say, the landlord, let me put it like that, the municipality, some of the terms that -- are in the process to be discussed yet with the municipality. So -- but I think in some logical sense from the MNO, they tend to link, let's say, the traffic which is delivered by that small cell in comparison to a macro and this is a sort of, let's say, threshold that they are willing to pay for a small cell. But this is part of the issues which are on, let's say, on the topics to be work done on the test.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Next question comes from Emmet Kelly from Morgan Stanley.
componenttext: Next question comes from Emmet Kelly from Morgan Stanley.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: I got 3 quick questions, please. And first one is on Spain. I've seen that Yoigo has said that they're looking to expand their network in Spain, maybe looking at adding about 5,000 or 6,000 PoPs in Spain, and have you seen opportunity there for some secon
componenttext: I got 3 quick questions, please. And first one is on Spain. I've seen that Yoigo has said that they're looking to expand their network in Spain, maybe looking at adding about 5,000 or 6,000 PoPs in Spain, and have you seen opportunity there for some secondary tenancies or maybe build to suit? That's my first question. And second question and just looking at the map that you have on Page 7 of the presentation, I see you've outlined a few of new-ish markets, Portugal, U.K., Germany, and I know it's early, you said in Italy you need a partner in that market to do what you're looking -- are you actually looking for partners in those countries as well, or are you looking to buy off some debted operators who are looking for maybe some remedies that might come out of proposed consolidation? Just trying to think about what your thinking is on these markets. Or whether these maybe Northern European markets may be more secondary for you? Then just the last question kind of more of a throwaway question. Just looking at the same map. I see you mentioned consolidation in Italy. And does that consolidation refer to consolidation between Inwit and Cellnex as being the opportunity? Or consolidation between Hutch and WIND? And assuming Hutch and WIND does get approved by the commission, could you explain why this is one of the opportunities that could fare well for you.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, today, on your first question about Yoigo. Today, Yoigo is a relevant customer of Cellnex in Spain. Today, we have 2,500 points of presence with Yoigo. And as you can imagine, if Yoigo wants to roll out a new 4G network, we will be there. I will kno
componenttext: Well, today, on your first question about Yoigo. Today, Yoigo is a relevant customer of Cellnex in Spain. Today, we have 2,500 points of presence with Yoigo. And as you can imagine, if Yoigo wants to roll out a new 4G network, we will be there. I will know in which size or what will be the final approach. But I cannot tell you anything else, because this is a very sensitive information from our customer. But of course, it could be a potential opportunity if this project will happen. On your question about the Slide # -- Page #7, well, for us makes sense to reach agreements with local partners if the roles will be complementary, I mean, like to us [ph]. We are investors, as you know, we have a clear role. We have a clear strategy over Europe. But it doesn't mean that to get local partners is a must. But -- because if you look back on our Galata transaction, we didn't get any kind of partner. But when we approach Inwit, as you can imagine, if you add Galata, and on top of that, Inwit, it will count more than 50% of our current business. So this is the reason why we thought that it makes sense to approach and to look for a local partner and F2i fits very well with us.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: [indiscernible] with Inwit or Hutch.
componenttext: [indiscernible] with Inwit or Hutch.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, from our point of view, the consolidation for us makes more sense in the name of Inwit. I mean, Inwit is the current network that fits 100% with us, makes a lot of sense in terms of synergies. Because for us, Italy is not project, it is a real opera
componenttext: Well, from our point of view, the consolidation for us makes more sense in the name of Inwit. I mean, Inwit is the current network that fits 100% with us, makes a lot of sense in terms of synergies. Because for us, Italy is not project, it is a real operation. We are delivering 1/3 of our revenues, and we have 50% of our assets in Italy, and we have the national coverage network. So this is the reason why we are at -- well, the consolidation between WIND and Hutch maybe is a fact in the whole of Europe, in every country. Consolidation will happen in every country. But for us in terms of infrastructures, it's attractive to approach in the meaning of telecom infrastructure companies like Inwit.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Next question comes from James Ratzer from New Street Research.
componenttext: Next question comes from James Ratzer from New Street Research.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Two questions. First one was regarding the potential bid for Inwit, and it's been widely rumored that in the first round, EI Towers had the highest bid. But they were only willing to bid for a 30% stake in Inwit. Just wanted to check that you would not be
componenttext: Two questions. First one was regarding the potential bid for Inwit, and it's been widely rumored that in the first round, EI Towers had the highest bid. But they were only willing to bid for a 30% stake in Inwit. Just wanted to check that you would not be willing to go down for a 30% stake. You have said I think on the commentary you'd make a mandatory offer if your bid was successful. And I just wanted to check if there is any flexibility on that from your perspective. And secondly, just regarding M&A in other countries, following on from Emmet's previous question. You've got quite a wide range of countries you are now interested in across Europe. Firstly, I would presume we would only see you move in those countries if the Inwit bid is unsuccessful. And secondly, which countries do you think are most appealing to you? When you're looking at these countries, what is it in particular that you would be most interested in looking for?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Well, it's very difficult to reply to the first question because it is a very sensitive information regarding the offers. But as we are aware, at least from the press, it's true, taking into consideration that we have no information -- official info
componenttext: Okay. Well, it's very difficult to reply to the first question because it is a very sensitive information regarding the offers. But as we are aware, at least from the press, it's true, taking into consideration that we have no information -- official information for other offers, if it's true that others are submitting 29.9%, first of all, that I want to remark is that, well, I believe the process letter from TI was very clear, at least 45% of the stake. Second remark is that I want to underline is that if you submit below 30%, minority shareholders of Inwit will be out of this transaction. And third one is that Cellnex is an investor partner, and our DNA is to manage the whole infrastructure, to manage the company, with efficiency synergies [ph] [indiscernible] and protect the responsibility, in front of our shareholders, of this project. So this is the reason why for us it doesn't make sense to be 30% or 29.9%. Second question, our project is Europe, it's not Spain, it's not Italy. For sure, Italy and Spain today are our first priority. I'm not telling you that, for us, it's the same company without or with Inwit, but we have other opportunities in our pipeline for sure. But we want to prioritize today our opportunities, and for sure, Italy and Spain consolidation are our first priority, and this is the reason why Inwit makes a lot of sense in the next weeks. But for sure, if we don't succeed Inwit, we will proceed with other opportunities that we have in our pipeline.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: And do you see other opportunities in your pipeline and is there anything specific in the different countries that you would be looking for to rank the attractiveness that leads to the different other countries in Europe you're looking at?
componenttext: And do you see other opportunities in your pipeline and is there anything specific in the different countries that you would be looking for to rank the attractiveness that leads to the different other countries in Europe you're looking at?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, as we stated several times before, for us it is very important to be in the 5 countries -- in the big 5 countries in Europe, I mean, Spain and Italy, but France, Germany and U.K. as well. It would be our second priority after the consolidation of It
componenttext: Well, as we stated several times before, for us it is very important to be in the 5 countries -- in the big 5 countries in Europe, I mean, Spain and Italy, but France, Germany and U.K. as well. It would be our second priority after the consolidation of Italy and Spain.

componenttext: The rationalization process, I would like to understand if you have a few retrospect some -- a small number of big framework agreements and big deals or -- with MNOs? componenttext: Okay. In terms of rationalization, those are very much, let's say, engineering projects, and we work on them batch by batch as a general rule. componenttext: I just got 2 on organic PoP growth, please. Firstly, organic PoP growth this year is certainly ahead of expectations that you laid out at the IPO. componenttextpreview: In terms of the difference here [ph], I think we've been as we mentioned, or José Manuel was mentioning before, obviously, our expectations in Italy in terms of the original business plan, we're never, let's say, too close from the framework agreement in
componenttext: In terms of the difference here [ph], I think we've been as we mentioned, or José Manuel was mentioning before, obviously, our expectations in Italy in terms of the original business plan, we're never, let's say, too close from the framework agreement in terms of new [indiscernible] that surpass to reach this growth alongside also in Spain. So in that sense, the organic, let's say, requirements based basically in terms of requirements of new box due to densification, which has been most probably the, let's say, requirements from our customers that led this growth. I understand that the second part of your question is whether we are in a position to maintain this.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: It certainly is this question, but I think that from now on, we think that this 8% is typical, it could be less in the future. And at the same time, we should see some rationalization. So the organic growth trend or mix should change a little. The 8% has
componenttext: It certainly is this question, but I think that from now on, we think that this 8% is typical, it could be less in the future. And at the same time, we should see some rationalization. So the organic growth trend or mix should change a little. The 8% has been exceptional. All our guidance has now running 3%, 4% in the long term, which makes sense. I need more -- we're working for more of course [indiscernible] this for every month [ph].

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: We're talking about 3%, 4% of organic growth taking into consideration low inflation.
componenttext: We're talking about 3%, 4% of organic growth taking into consideration low inflation.

componenttext: Well, for us, as I told you this morning, Telefonica is one of our main and relevant customers. So we're managing our relationship as it is. Second one, we have to understand finally more on the specific strategy of Telefónica on that later [ph], because as you are aware, this is a mix of different type of prospectors [ph], not only in Spain, Italy and other countries with -- even with some are in cable or I don't know what will be the final perimeter. And I think this is another characteristic of our project. And the scope of Europe, if I'm not wrong, may be overlapping with the perimeter of this company will be in Spain, but our scope is the whole Europe. And again, for us, [indiscernible] and independent, it's very important to be the consolidator in every country.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Next question comes from Ottavio Adorisio from Societe Generale.
componenttext: Next question comes from Ottavio Adorisio from Societe Generale.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Ottavio Adorisio. So I have a number of follow-up questions. The first is on the backhauling. Looking at the backhauling, it looks like the business model is rather different from the one that you've done in the past, and in the past situation you
componenttext: This is Ottavio Adorisio. So I have a number of follow-up questions. The first is on the backhauling. Looking at the backhauling, it looks like the business model is rather different from the one that you've done in the past, and in the past situation you bought towers and then you leased space. Here you are to build. And so my question is that you mentioned EUR 20 million opportunistic CapEx. How much more on the expansion CapEx you've released today, or otherwise [ph] 10% of revenues, would be backhauling? And secondly, if it's all from the revenue model, how it works in the backhauling, how you're going to charge for it? And will there be any synergy with the core business? I believe that towers will provide the backhauling, probably you can extract more in terms of rental? The second question is on the broadcasting. Broadcasting revenues are down around EUR 25 million. EUR 15 million are basically one-offs. The question is, what's the rest, and how are we to think about that going forward into 2016? And the third is on the dynamics of any potential rights issue for the transaction with Inwit. More precisely, you basically stressed that you want to keep flexibility, you don't know what the markets will look like if the transaction completes, if there is transaction anyway, but then you will support 6.5x as your peak for net debt-to-EBITDA. It's a bit difficult to imagine that you can do with 6.5x the entire transaction. Therefore, how you're going to basically take the flexibility in the rights issue if you can -- if you basically stop your game after the 6.5x, what else you can do?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: [indiscernible]. Regarding the first one is EUR 20 million of CapEx. Obviously, did you ask now -- what percentage of the 5%, 10% guidelines if we have to obtain from this initiative. To be honest, right now, I don't know. What we do know is that what wil
componenttext: [indiscernible]. Regarding the first one is EUR 20 million of CapEx. Obviously, did you ask now -- what percentage of the 5%, 10% guidelines if we have to obtain from this initiative. To be honest, right now, I don't know. What we do know is that what will happen this year. This year we have invested EUR 30 million of expansion CapEx, which is percent by percent. Most of it has come from the simulcast, okay. So [indiscernible] at least 5% we need maybe for that opportunity of the backhauling or maybe for a simulcast tomorrow or maybe for this [indiscernible], but rest assured that step by step we will bring to you, this is an opportunity that will be [indiscernible] or 10%. Obviously, if we do 5%, the increase in revenue will be smaller than if we invest 10%. But I cannot tell you how much will be allocated -- not only this opportunity, backhauling, but also we are working on small cells, we are working on smart cities [indiscernible] 5%, 10% as long as we get [indiscernible]. Otherwise, we will not do it. Obviously, in these type questions you would ask [indiscernible] I think if there was some kind of economics of scale, what we took advantage is what the concept -- took advantage of something more, of course. I mean, we operate that backhauling is because we retain that in that tower, there will be [indiscernible] another financial model and maybe another one much later. So for us, at the end of the day, backhauling is another sharing experience [ph]. The tower is a sharing opportunity. So backhauling is again a sharing opportunity around larger contracts that has to be run batch by batch. We cannot give you [indiscernible]. I can't, I wish I could, but I can't. Your second question was about EUR 25 million, half of which is simulcast [ph] more or less what's coming from simulcast, I thought you said. And the other half is coming from what? Okay, I think that it is true that the simulcast is what you said, something one-off. But at the same time, you have to take into account that expansion CapEx will allow us to have this kind of one-offs in a regular basis [ph], as we were saying before, but on top of that, another half of this EUR 25 million, higher I think you said, is [indiscernible] I mean, you have EUR 8 million [indiscernible] presentation, and the rest -- so the rest is [indiscernible] efficiency, more or less this is [indiscernible]. The thing is, at the end of the day, that the company is performing well, performing very well. I think that indeed in 2016 we will be able to deliver what we are committing again. [indiscernible] As you know, we're a prudent company. We are a prudent management team, and we try to give something that we are able to deliver step-by-step. So you have [indiscernible] but you have to take into account. And also regarding the rights issue, you are right. If we go to the 6.5x net debt-to-EBITDA, we cannot [indiscernible]. However, as I explained before, [indiscernible] is not only to go to 6.5x net debt-to-EBITDA. This is opportunity, but also to be commensurate in the market situation with the bond market, with the debt market, we have to be coherent. Because as you know, the market is important, but as you said, the opportunities in the pipeline is important. So rest assured that if we go to the market, at some point, we have rights issues because [indiscernible] coherence framework, not only because we have done Inwit or if not or is a coherent thing, okay. And with net debt-to-EBITDA perspective will make sense, and from a recurring levered free cash flow per share, I can assure you will be accretive. Which at the end of the day is what we think our shareholders are asking for.

componenttext: Yes. It is an opportunity for sure. Maybe we could be part of the remedies, we could be part of a solution. In Italy, we know very well in advance the potential merger between WIND and Hutch. We have good protection in our contracts. But looking into the future, we could help even if the merger happens or not. But maybe another example of that and maybe you're referring for is U.K. But again, today, our priority is to approach and to understand if we can succeed on the Inwit transaction because we have to submit the binding offers at the mid of March and as you can imagine, we are 100% devoted to understand if we can succeed or not.

componenttext: I have 2 questions. The first question is to do with tax. I noticed that you've -- I believe that there is a rule or law in Italy that allows you to convert goodwill into tax deductions. Have you already capitalized on that? And then secondly, if there is similar -- any similar opportunities in Spain? And then my second question, I think in the third quarter, you mentioned the framework agreement with a mobile broadband operator for around 1,500 sites, can you just give us an update on that contract or that arrangement?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 19, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, Jon [indiscernible] follow very well and the tax [indiscernible] evolution of that makes sense and it is this goodwill change of law took place in Italy as of December 28, 2015. And finally, it seems possible to depreciate a goodwill from 10 years t
componenttext: Well, Jon [indiscernible] follow very well and the tax [indiscernible] evolution of that makes sense and it is this goodwill change of law took place in Italy as of December 28, 2015. And finally, it seems possible to depreciate a goodwill from 10 years to 5 years. The thing is that in order to depreciate this goodwill for tax purposes in 5 years' time, you need to pay upfront 16% of the goodwill. And then you can somehow get back, let's say, the corporate tax income of the company multiplied by the goodwill for 5 years [indiscernible] divided by 5 for 5 years. So this is something that can take place as long as there is a measure and as long as this goodwill counts as in the balance sheet of the company. So it cannot be a consolidated goodwill, it has to be a goodwill that appears in the financial audited statements of the company. And in order to show, as you know, you have to match the target and the [indiscernible]. And this is something that mainly it depends on the structure, maybe it doesn't happen. So this is the first caveat. And the second caveat is -- the second caveat I would say to you regarding the goodwill is you have to pay upfront as we said. And finally, you have to do a CPA exercise, [indiscernible] allocation in which you say how much of this goodwill has to be allocated to assets and the cost [indiscernible] and how much of this goodwill can be retained as goodwill [indiscernible]. So Jon, there are the laws here, there are 3 limitations and it's not easy to fulfill all of them. You can't take for granted that if we finally, as per the company, we will accept this in detail, we are [indiscernible] in detail, but it's not easy to implement. And second, the question is...

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon, everyone. May name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by José Manuel Geisler, CFO and M&A Director, who will lead today's presentation. I would like to thank you all for joining us today fo
componenttext:
Good afternoon, everyone. May name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by José Manuel Geisler, CFO and M&A Director, who will lead today's presentation. I would like to thank you all for joining us today for Cellnex Inc. Q1 2016 Results Conference Call. We had earlier today posted a presentation, which we will refer to throughout our prepared remarks in the Investor Relations section on our website. And then we'll open the line for our Q&A session. 
So now I'll hand over to José Manuel. Please, José Manuel.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon. Thank you so much for your time today, and please allow me to start by highlighting the main managed terms of the period. So Page 4 of the presentation. Today, we are presenting again a solid set of results that confirm our cash flow visib
componenttext:
Good afternoon. Thank you so much for your time today, and please allow me to start by highlighting the main managed terms of the period. So Page 4 of the presentation. Today, we are presenting again a solid set of results that confirm our cash flow visibility. Our recurring level of free cash flow for the period has been slightly above the market expectations. We continue to be in a privileged position to capture future organic growth opportunities. We are the natural candidate to consolidate the European tower landscape. Also, all uncertainties around the broadcasting business have been completely removed. And finally, we are now -- we are glad to announce that our bond is now eligible for the European Central Bank purchase program of corporate bonds. 
Moving now to the next slide. In terms of activities, we have managed to increase the number of PoPs by 1% compared to December 2015. We are also paving the way for future organic growth by signing contracts in the small cell areas and distributed antenna systems in tunnels. We are also analyzing new tasks and projects to reinstall and shopping centers and car parks. We continue to pursue rationalization projects with mobile operators and we are working hard to announce an agreement in the short term. We are also assessing the possibility to invest in fiber backhauling to the tower for our customers, and this analyzes is showing a very good progress. Finally, we are constantly engaging in conversations with other clients to assess the potential to improve their coverage, which have resulted in new framework agreement signed. 
In the broadcasting area, we can confirm that all uncertainties have been completely removed, that the retendering process of 6 new TV channels have been successfully completed with all our channels today broadcasting, thus, providing a stable revenue platform going forward. 
In the network services and other areas, we have also seen a strong network, a strong performance, thanks to the connectivity business. We have also managed to extend our IoT network in Spain with around 170 [ph] additional sites. And we have won several PPDR contracts for transport and utilities applications. 
In the smart cities area, we have submitted 2 [ph] proposals in the context of the binding procedures opened by the Spanish government. On top of this, we keep analyzing opportunities to continue creating value for our shareholders, and one example is our efficiency program. In this context, we are making good progress on the ground lease front by approaching our landlords with proposals to renegotiate terms and cash advance. 
Turning to Slide #6. You can see here the evolution of PoPs and our resulting consolidated tenancy ratio with the impact of organic growth explaining the changes. We have managed to add more than 200 PoPs in the period, reaching a tenancy ratio of 1.54. On the next chart, we explain in detail the performance of the Telecom Site Rental business in terms of revenues, and you can see how the existing asset base contribute EUR 2 million to our consolidated figures while the change of perimeter adds EUR 54 million in the period. 
Moving now to adjusted EBITDA. You can see the negative impact of DTT simulcast, which was a one-off positive effect last year, and this impact is more than offset by the contribution of organic and inorganic growth. Also the positive contribution of organic growth of EUR 2.5 million in this quarter. 
Let me now explain in detail our recurring leverage of free cash flow generation in the quarter. Slide 7. I would like to start by highlighting the recurring level of free cash flow in the period has increased 14%. 
Looking now to revenues. Telecom Site Rental increases mainly due to a strong organic growth and acquisitions. The broadcasting business is no longer reflecting the simulcast carryout in 2015, and network services and others show a strong increased mainly due to a high activity in the connectivity business. 
Moving to OpEx. We have a very well-contained cost base with a flat performance on a like-for-like basis. Increase shown is mainly due to cost directly associated with our recent acquisitions. Our adjusted EBITDA for the quarter, which is EUR 63.5 million, in line with our full year guidance and showing a strong 26% increase when compared to last year. Our working capital change remains positive, thanks to our strict management, although we expect this to be neutral at year-end in line with our full year guidance. Interest paid reflect our current capital structure with a first coupon associated with our bond due in July. And tax paid, reflecting implementation of tax management measures as well as the tax regular payment schedule. 
Maintenance CapEx will be catching up during the year to reach normalized levels in line with our guidance. Our non-M&A expansion CapEx include the first step of our efficiency program with EUR 6 million associated with cash advances. As a result, you can see that our recurring level of free cash flow represents EUR 66 million  [ph] million compared to our adjusted EBITDA of EUR 63 [ph] million, which means a conversion ratio of more than 100%. 
Moving now to Slide #8. Our balance sheet and concerning our leverage, we can say that it has decreased to 3.6x in terms of net debt and annualized EBITDA, which is below our long-term leverage ratio of 4x net debt-to-EBITDA. Our total net debt, as you can see in this slide, is EUR 901 million with our bond accounting for most of the debt. When assessing the change in the net debt, it needs to be taken into account that in January, we paid the second tranche of the last towers acquired from Telefonica back in January 2015. 
Coming back to the remaining lines of our income statement, depreciation and amortization changes, these increased mainly as a result of our recent acquisitions. Finally, Cellnex net profit reaches EUR 11 million with increased revenues partly offset by depreciation change. 
Moving to Slide 9. The assumptions behind our financial outlook for the full year 2015 are still valid. We believe that we can provide a recurring level of free cash flow that will exceed 10% higher than in 2015, which is in line with market expectations. Looking at the different contribution lines, also the same assumptions apply for each of them, confirming the high visibility of our business. 
Finally, Slide 10 and 11, these 2 slides will be taken together. So let me finish the presentation by saying with you why we believe Cellnex is an attractive investment opportunity. From the current operational perspective, Cellnex is a company with solid fundamentals that provides cash flow visibility inorganic growth option ability, leveraging our future revenues streams. But also, on the Slide 11, we can see that, thanks to our flexible balance sheet, a strict investment criteria and independency of our neutral operator like Cellnex, we are in a privileged position to consolidate the European tower landscape. It is also important to highlight the current low interest rate environment as a consequence of the recent purchase programs announced by the European Central Bank, from which we can benefit by obtaining very attractive financial rates for future expansion. So in a nutshell, Cellnex today is a combination of strong generator of visible cash flows. We -- I would say, optionability in terms of M&A and organic growth. Everything together, I would say, an attractive valuation as of today.

Hopefully, we should receive next statement by the seller, but I can tell you that the company in this case has been sensitive to all the points that the seller is highlighting us and we are looking forward to receiving the next statement. Also, it is true that we cannot state here with offer of very high money open for a long period of time because you know that we are confident and we are [indiscernible] key  transaction institutions are also having on committees and that has resulted in, let's say, deadlines. But we are looking forward to receiving the next steps and to present, hopefully, our very best offer. We don't think that at the end of the day, Simon, we expect that the position from the board of Italia is the one we are looking for. The next 2 questions were regarding, I think,  [indiscernible] the first was regarding news that has been released in tell shows and I would say Telefonica Deutschland. componenttext: I just had a couple of questions. Firstly, on the cash advances you've paid, when can we expect that to result in OpEx savings? And can you please give any color in terms of what size we can expect? And then secondly, in terms of your new PoPs, could you give us split how much is MNOs and what are other customers essentially? And also if you could give a little bit more color on your framework agreements, which market is and then maybe if you can say anything in terms of time frame and size as well.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Let me -- I will answer #1 and #3, and maybe [indiscernible]  can help question #2. The cash advance, as you know, we launched through our efficiency program and that was announced in 2015 results. And I think that the program is working very well an
componenttext: Yes. Let me -- I will answer #1 and #3, and maybe [indiscernible]  can help question #2. The cash advance, as you know, we launched through our efficiency program and that was announced in 2015 results. And I think that the program is working very well and all the investment in this EUR 6 [ph] million of cash advance that we have securities and in this term are following the main criteria that we have, which is probably speaking at least unlevered IRR of low double-digit. Let me [indiscernible] this topic because we are in the middle of conversations with several landlords in both countries and we have to be here and very prudent. But it is working well. It is working with attractive paybacks, and I think it is a measure that is an important impact or one of the most important cost lines of our company. Regarding the framework agreements, as you can read in Page #5 of our presentation, we are working with different MNOs in framework agreements. And broadly speaking, next to coverage station extensions in both countries in Spain and also in Italy. At the end of the day, it seems that there are a lot of 4G requires, requires tower, requires good positioning. And this new framework agreements that we tried to also keep the name of the client and the country for us, let me say that we will come up as PoPs, organic PoPs, in the next quarters. And we are very happy with this 1% growth of PoPs in this quarter, and we'll think this is a good trend that we will be supported by these agreements. And also [indiscernible] I think your question on the position will need to answer.

componenttext: Yes, on these PoPs, I would say in Spain, the [indiscernible] PoPs come from MNOs maybe 70% [ph] with the rest coming from nontraditional operators such as mobile operators and similar situation in Italy with 50% coming from tertiary MNOs and 50% coming from [indiscernible] operators.

Do we see further growth year? Or is that kind of runaway that you see for a couple of years?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016

componenttext: No, I think [indiscernible] question, the third question is that will have finished our last decommissioning program and now we'll have to engage in a new decommissioning program. In the meantime, the organic growth, the only source of organic growth is a normal PoP growth in the market. So this is what we can say.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Mark, let me clarify that. All the decommissioning we've been doing so far have been only with urban towers. So you know that we have been acquiring towers mostly in Spain from Telefonica and Yoigo and we knew beforehand that that's something that need to
componenttext: Mark, let me clarify that. All the decommissioning we've been doing so far have been only with urban towers. So you know that we have been acquiring towers mostly in Spain from Telefonica and Yoigo and we knew beforehand that that's something that need to be dismantled. And this is what we've been doing for several years and that process is almost closed. Now what we want to do is to decommission third-party towers and it is for the economics. We're not on cost reduction because of having secondary network, but on attracting new tenants on our site by decommissioning towers owned by third-party operators.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: And regarding your second question, which is the revenue mix. While you have to -- I don't know exactly what you are comparing when you talk about this 26 or 27 [indiscernible] but if you compare with last quarter 2015, which can be the data you are follo
componenttext: And regarding your second question, which is the revenue mix. While you have to -- I don't know exactly what you are comparing when you talk about this 26 or 27 [indiscernible] but if you compare with last quarter 2015, which can be the data you are following here or you are comparing the full year 2015, you have to be aware that in year 2015, we didn't -- we acquired the towers of WIND regarding the project as of the end of March 2015. So there can be here a small mismatch in the average because of M&A. So in general, we say to you that in this mismatch is -- this gap is not considered to be more aligned.
