headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, who will lead today's presentation. I would like to thank you all for joining us today for
componenttext:
Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan, and I'm the Head of Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, who will lead today's presentation. 
I would like to thank you all for joining us today for Cellnex Inc. Q1 2016 Results Conference Call. We have, earlier today, posted a presentation, which we will refer to throughout our prepared remarks under the Investor Relations section on our website. And then we'll open the line for a Q&A session.
So now I'll hand over to José Manuel. Please, José Manuel.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon. Thank you so much for your time today. And please allow me to start by highlighting the main milestones for the period, so Page 4 of the presentation. Today, we are presenting again a solid set of results that confirm our cash flow visibil
componenttext:
Good afternoon. Thank you so much for your time today. And please allow me to start by highlighting the main milestones for the period, so Page 4 of the presentation. Today, we are presenting again a solid set of results that confirm our cash flow visibility. Our recurring levered free cash flow for the period has been slightly above the market expectations. We continue to be in a privileged position to capture future organic growth opportunities. We are the natural candidate to consolidate the European tower landscape. Also, all uncertainties around the broadcasting business have been completely removed. And finally, we are glad to announce that our bond is now eligible for the European Central Bank purchase program of corporate bonds.
Moving now to the next slide. In terms of activities, we have managed to increase the number of PoPs by 1% compared to December 2015. We are also paving the way for future organic growth by signing contracts in the small cell areas and distributed antenna systems in tunnels. We are also analyzing new DAS projects to be installed in shopping centers and car parks. We continue to pursue rationalization projects with mobile operators, and we are working hard to announce an agreement in the short term. We are also assessing the possibility to invest in fiber backhauling to the tower for our customers, and this analysis is showing a very good progress. Finally, we are constantly engaging in conversations with other clients to assess the potential to improve their coverage, which have resulted in new framework agreement signed.
In the broadcasting area, we can confirm that all uncertainties have been completely removed, that the retendering process of 6 new TV channels have been successfully completed with all channels today broadcasting, thus, providing a stable revenue platform going forward. 
In the network services and other areas, we have also seen a strong network -- a strong performance, thanks to the connectivity business. We have also managed to extend our IoT network in Spain with around 170 additional sites. And we have won several PPDR contracts for transport and utilities applications. In the Smart Cities area, we have submitted 2 proposals in the context of the binding procedures opened by the Spanish government. 
On top of this, we keep analyzing opportunities to continue creating value for our shareholders, and one example is our efficiency program. In this context, we are making good progress on the ground lease front by approaching our landlords with proposals to renegotiate terms and cash advance.
Turning to Slide #6. You can see here the evolution of PoPs and our resulting consolidated tenancy ratio, with the impact of organic growth explaining the changes. We have managed to add more than 200 PoPs in the period, reaching a tenancy ratio of 1.54. On the next chart, we explain in detail the performance of the Telecom Site Rental business in terms of revenues, and you can see how the existing asset base contribute EUR 2 million to our consolidated figures while the change of perimeter adds EUR 54 million in the period.
Moving now to adjusted EBITDA. You can see the negative impact of DTT simulcast, which was a one-off positive effect last year. And this impact is more than offset by the contribution of an organic and inorganic growth, with also the positive contribution of organic growth of EUR 2.5 million in this quarter.
Let me now explain in detail our recurring levered free cash flow generation in the quarter. Slide 7. I would like to start by highlighting that the recurring levered free cash flow in the period has increased 14%. 
Looking now to revenues. Telecom Site Rental increase is mainly due to a strong organic growth and acquisitions. The broadcasting business is no longer reflecting the simulcast carryout in 2015, and network services and others show a strong increase mainly due to a high activity in the connectivity business. 
Moving to OpEx. We have a very well-contained cost base with a flat performance on a like-for-like basis. The increase shown is mainly due to cost directly associated with our recent acquisitions. Our adjusted EBITDA for the quarter reaches EUR 63.5 million, in line with our full year guidance and showing a strong 26% increase when compared to last year. Our working capital change remains positive, thanks to our strict management. Although we expect this to be neutral at the year-end, in line with our full year guidance. Interest paid reflect our current capital structure with the first coupon associated with our bond due in July. And tax paid reflect the implementation of tax management measures as well as the tax regular payment schedule.
Maintenance CapEx will be catching up during the year to reach normalized levels, in line with our guidance. Our non-M&A expansion CapEx include the first step of our efficiency program with EUR 6 million associated with cash advances. As a result, you can see that our recurring levered free cash flow represents EUR 66 million compared to our adjusted EBITDA of EUR 63 million, which means a conversion ratio of more than 100%.
Moving now to Slide #8. Our balance sheet and concerning our leverage, we can say that it has decreased to 3.6x in terms of net debt annualized EBITDA, which is below our long-term leverage target ratio of 4x net debt-to-EBITDA. Our total net debt, as you can see in this slide, is EUR 901 million with our bond accounting for most of the debt. When assessing the change in the net debt, it needs to be taken into account that, in January, we paid the second tranche of the last towers acquired from Telefonica back in January 2015.
Coming back to the remaining lines of our income statement, depreciation and amortization changes, these increased mainly as a result of our recent acquisitions. Finally, Cellnex net profit reaches EUR 11 million, with increased revenues partly offset by depreciation change.
Moving to Slide 9. The assumptions behind our financial outlook for the full year 2016 are still valid. We believe that we can provide a recurring levered free cash flow that will exceed 10% higher than in 2015, which is in line with market expectations. Looking at the different contribution lines, also the same assumptions apply for each of them, confirming the high visibility of our business.
Finally, Slide 10 and 11, these 2 slides will be taken together. So let me finish the presentation by sharing with you why we believe Cellnex is an attractive investment opportunity. From the current operational perspective, Cellnex is a company with solid fundamentals that provides cash flow visibility and organic growth optionability, leveraging our future revenues streams. But also, on the Slide 11, we can see that thanks to our flexible balance sheet, a strict investment criteria and independency of a neutral operator like Cellnex, we are in a privileged position to consolidate the European tower landscape. It is also important to highlight the current low interest rate environments as a consequence of the recent purchase programs announced by the European Central Bank, from which we can benefit by obtaining very attractive financial rates for future expansion. 
So in a nutshell, Cellnex today is a combination of a strong generator of visible cash flows. We -- I would say, optionability in terms of M&A and organic growth. Everything together, I would say, an attractive valuation as of today.

componenttextpreview: Okay, good. Just to start with the first question regarding -- well, I mean, this is according to the first product information, so we just sent a binding offer some weeks ago. And this binding offer, I think that, somehow, we have received feedback from
componenttext: Okay, good. Just to start with the first question regarding -- well, I mean, this is according to the first product information, so we just sent a binding offer some weeks ago. And this binding offer, I think that, somehow, we have received feedback from the seller explaining to us with different points that we think should come in. Right now, we are working on these points. Hopefully, we should receive next steps by the seller. But I can tell you that the company, Cellnex, in this case, has been sensitive to all the points that the seller is highlighting us, and we are looking forward to receiving the next steps. Also, it is true that we cannot stay here with offer of very high amount of money open for a long period of time because you know that we are confident and we are based on key -- to other banking institutions that also have their own committees and they also have their own, let's say, deadlines. But we are looking forward to receiving the next steps and to present, hopefully, our very best offer. We don't think that at the end of the day -- Simon, we expect the position from the board of Telecom Italia. This is the what we are looking for. The next 2 questions were regarding, I think, Telxius. The first was regarding this -- today, news that has been released in Telxius and I would say Telefonica Deutschland. It seems to me -- I only have the public information that is it's a intercompany transaction and I cannot assess it at all. I have the same information you have. It seems that Telxius is pulling together a bunch of assets and with different -- from different countries and from different, I would say, sectors of activity, but I cannot comment. I wish I could, but I can't. And your last question, sorry, maybe I didn't capture very well. I think it was the rural towers of Telxius.

componenttext: Yes. And regarding U.K., U.K., and I think this is coming from the release of this morning. U.K. is one of the more dynamic markets in Europe. And I think that we all follow in detail what's going on in terms of antitrust, in terms of different towering companies that somehow could change the landscape in the next months. But this does not mean in terms of being dynamic. This does not mean that we are not looking on other opportunities in Continental Europe. So we keep an eye on it. Obviously, in the full service -- is the first question you have made, which makes sense. It's a transformational move for us. But do not hesitate that we are looking also at opportunities in Europe, being the U.K. also an interesting market for us. And your second question was a payment, but I could not follow, so sorry.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: I just had a couple of questions. Firstly, on the cash advances you've paid. When can we expect that to result in OpEx savings? And can you please give any color in terms of what size we can expect? And then secondly, in terms of your new PoPs, can you gi
componenttext: I just had a couple of questions. Firstly, on the cash advances you've paid. When can we expect that to result in OpEx savings? And can you please give any color in terms of what size we can expect? And then secondly, in terms of your new PoPs, can you give a split how much is MNOs and what are other customers essentially? And also if you could give a little bit more color on your framework agreements, which market it is in and maybe if you can say anything in terms of time frame and size as well?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Let me -- I will answer #1 and #3, and maybe Juan Jose can answer back the #2. The cash advance, as you know, we launched through our efficiency program, and that was announced in 2015 results. And I think that the program is working very well, and a
componenttext:
Yes. Let me -- I will answer #1 and #3, and maybe Juan Jose can answer back the #2. The cash advance, as you know, we launched through our efficiency program, and that was announced in 2015 results. And I think that the program is working very well, and all the investments in this EUR 6 million of cash advance that we have executed in this term are following the main criteria that we have, which is broadly speaking, at least an unlevered IRR of low double-digit. Let me be cautious in this topic because we are in the middle of conversations with several landlords in both countries and we have to be here and very prudent. But it is working well. It is working attractive paybacks, and I think it's a measure that has an important impact or one of the most important cost lines of our company. Regarding the framework agreements, as you can read in Page #5 of our presentation, we are working with different MNOs in framework agreements.
And broadly speaking next to coverage stations -- extensions in both countries, in Spain and also in Italy. At the end of the day, it seems that the rollout of 4G requires tower, requires good positioning. And these new framework agreements that we tried to also keep the name of the client and the country for us, let me say that will come up as PoPs, organic PoPs, in the next quarters. And we are very happy with this 1% growth of PoPs in this quarter, and we think that this is a good trend that will be supported by these agreements. 
And also I think this question about [indiscernible] position, we need to answer.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. On the split of PoPs, I would say, in Spain, the agility of our PoPs come from traditional MNOs, maybe 70%, with the rest coming from nontraditional operators such as mobile-driven [ph] operators. And a similar situation in Italy, with 50% coming fro
componenttext: Yes. On the split of PoPs, I would say, in Spain, the agility of our PoPs come from traditional MNOs, maybe 70%, with the rest coming from nontraditional operators such as mobile-driven [ph] operators. And a similar situation in Italy, with 50% coming from traditional MNOs and 50% coming from wireless mobile[ph] operators.

componenttext: It's Mark Murphy from Macquarie. I just want to ask you on your decommissioning number. I know there's kind of been a question on this already, but it seems to be quite low with just 2 sites in the first quarter. And I was wondering, could you kind of give us a reason for that? And maybe also an update on how -- the 5,000 target lease renegotiations, how that is progressing. And -- because I know decommissioning, at least renegotiations, tend to kind of happen together in some respects. And then also just a short kind of question on your average revenue per site. It seems to have increased up to EUR 27,000. I was wondering what's driving that in particular. Is it Italy or Spain? And do we see further growth here? Or is that a kind of run rate that you see for a couple of years?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thanks. Mark, thank you for the questions. The third question is, well, that we'll have finished our last decommissioning program. And now we'll have to engage in a new decommissioning program. In the meantime, the organic growth -- the only source of org
componenttext: Thanks. Mark, thank you for the questions. The third question is, well, that we'll have finished our last decommissioning program. And now we'll have to engage in a new decommissioning program. In the meantime, the organic growth -- the only source of organic growth is a normal PoP growth in the market. So this is what we can say.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Mark, let me clarify that. All the decommissioning we've been doing so far has been with own towers. So you know that we've been acquiring towers mostly in Spain from Telefonica and Yoigo, and we knew beforehand that somewhat they needed to be disman
componenttext: Yes. Mark, let me clarify that. All the decommissioning we've been doing so far has been with own towers. So you know that we've been acquiring towers mostly in Spain from Telefonica and Yoigo, and we knew beforehand that somewhat they needed to be dismantled. And this is what we've been doing for several years, and that process is almost closed. Now what we want to do is to decommission third-party towers. And so the economics are not focused on cost reduction because of having a redundant network, but on attracting new tenants on our site by decommissioning towers owned by third-party operators.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: And regarding your second question, which is the revenue mix, yes -- well, you have to -- I don't know exactly what you are comparing when you talk about this EUR 26,000 or EUR 27,000 exactly. But if you compare with last quarter 2015, which can be the da
componenttext: And regarding your second question, which is the revenue mix, yes -- well, you have to -- I don't know exactly what you are comparing when you talk about this EUR 26,000 or EUR 27,000 exactly. But if you compare with last quarter 2015, which can be the data you are following here, be aware -- or you are comparing the full year 2015, you have to be aware that in year 2015, we didn't -- we acquired -- sorry, we acquired the towers of WIND, the Galata project, as of -- at the end of March 2015. So there can be here a small mismatch in the average because of M&A. So in general, I would say to you that this mismatch is -- this gap is not considered to be more aligned.

componenttext: I had 2 questions, please. The first one, again, just kind of slightly following up on the points of presence growth, which looks encouraging. I was wondering if you could help to give us some thoughts over how you see the tenancy ratio being able to grow over the next 2 years? How much above 2 can that get to in Spain, over what time frame? It does sound encouraging what you are doing with some of the fixed wireless providers as well, so it'd be helpful to get some more color on how you see that over the next few years. And then the second question is on M&A. In a hypothetical situation that you're unsuccessful with the Inwit transaction, could you see a scenario in Italy where you actually might consider selling towers as a way of extracting more value from your existing portfolio?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you. Well, let me start by the second question. I think selling towers is something that right now we do not consider. I think that we have a portfolio that we have to expand, and it makes more sense to complete and to facilitate the country in Ital
componenttext: Thank you. Well, let me start by the second question. I think selling towers is something that right now we do not consider. I think that we have a portfolio that we have to expand, and it makes more sense to complete and to facilitate the country in Italy rather than selling it down. I think that the Italian towers have value. They belong to a network that cover the whole country. And if we can somehow be competitive in the Inwit process it's because we have a very good positioning in the country. If we lose this positioning we are -- maybe we are making money in the short term, but in the long term, we are losing value. So no -- so far, it's not the best-case scenario. Regarding the tenancy ratio, which is your first question, I will say to you that we have been quiet in -- maybe on other occasions. The organic growth we saw last year, 8%, is very high. I would say that, in a normal scenario, between 3% or 4% growth in number of PoPs makes sense. And then this will drive up our tenancy ratio step by step. We do think also that on top of this, we may have the decommissioning effect, and this could somehow increase further our tenancy ratio. For these 2 companies, the normal organic growth, 3%, 4% in a year, just add the decommissioning effect on top of this 3%, 4%.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Next question comes from Fernando Cordero from Banco Santander.
componenttext: Next question comes from Fernando Cordero from Banco Santander.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: And the first one is related with the coverage extension plans that you are announcing. And in that sense, I would like to know -- we just heard the recently announced extension plan by Yoigo, talking about -- of almost doubling the size of its network co
componenttext: And the first one is related with the coverage extension plans that you are announcing. And in that sense, I would like to know -- we just heard the recently announced extension plan by Yoigo, talking about -- of almost doubling the size of its network could be one of the drivers for this organic growth. And just to see if your current portfolio that was in Spain could be also of the interest of the Yoigo coverage expansion. The second question is related with the build-to-suit driver in number of towers, particularly in Italy. And in that sense, recalling the 400 towers that you have already win, we are not seeing yet delivery on that build-to-suit driver. I would like to know what are the reasons behind. Or is it something that should be accelerating? Or is that in incoming quarters? And finally, I think this question is related with rationalization deals. In that sense, I would like to know how or what are the key concerns that you are receiving from your potential partners for this rationalization deals. In order to [indiscernible], what are the solutions that you are providing? For example, is the impact in the coverage or the potential short-term breakages in the coverage that they are feeling or concerning on these rationalization deals. I would like to know what are these hurdles [indiscernible], if any. And I would just -- and are you trying to mitigate these concerns from the partners?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Fernando. Well, regarding the -- let's start by the third question. The rationalization deals are deals that take time and take time because this is, I would say, a value-added service that, as you were saying, yes, we have. Different implicati
componenttext: Thank you, Fernando. Well, regarding the -- let's start by the third question. The rationalization deals are deals that take time and take time because this is, I would say, a value-added service that, as you were saying, yes, we have. Different implications from [indiscernible] and from also, well, different -- there are different things that have to be assessed. It takes time to give comfort to the client, it takes time. But I think that the main concern is that this kind of transactions are somehow new. And we are opening the market, and then everyone in our clients would like to have a view on the deal and to have their own point of view. We fully respect and we thank the opportunity that our client give us in order to this -- to do this rationalization project. And at the same time, we have to follow their own concerns and their own decision-making process, which is not -- many times, it takes time, and this is not something customary that you do it from one day to the other. So this is your third question. The first question, you were talking about Yoigo. Yoigo, you know that it is truly -- they have very ambitious plan of coverage in 4G in Spain. Obviously, we have a close relationship with Yoigo. And I think that somehow we should be well positioned to capture part of the growth coming from this and other clients that have to extend their coverage. And finally, the build-to-suit in Italy, you are right. Somehow we are now localizing, so assessing different locations in order to build out the towers. And I think in the next couple of quarters, you will see that these 400 towers step by step are coming. And Fernando, this is something clear, the company is running well. And without maybe implementing yet the contractualized business we have already -- that will come in the next quarters, so I mean good performance without contractualized business that will come for sure.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Next question comes from Luigi Minerva from HSBC.
componenttext: Next question comes from Luigi Minerva from HSBC.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Two questions about your M&A strategy, the first on the U.K. Your CEO defined the market as a very dynamic one. I was wondering if you can tell us under what option your potential in U.K. would be better, if there is a merger between Hutchison and Telefon
componenttext: Two questions about your M&A strategy, the first on the U.K. Your CEO defined the market as a very dynamic one. I was wondering if you can tell us under what option your potential in U.K. would be better, if there is a merger between Hutchison and Telefonica. Or if there is no merger, which scenario would be preferable from your business point of view? And my second question is on Italy. And I was wondering, if it was instrumental to improve your presence on the telco side to acquire the broadcasting side, would you consider that?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. The -- thank you for your questions. The second question, the broadcasting towers, as we said in the roadshow presentation, and you can even read in our IOM, we say that the broadcasting towers is not an aim, per se. Maybe it's a mean to obtain somet
componenttext: Yes. The -- thank you for your questions. The second question, the broadcasting towers, as we said in the roadshow presentation, and you can even read in our IOM, we say that the broadcasting towers is not an aim, per se. Maybe it's a mean to obtain something else, something else which means more Telecom Site Rental. But it's not our priority. Our priority is more focused on acquiring Telecom Site Rental towers. Regarding the U.K., this is a question that has been somehow raised before. We do think that -- we tend to -- not to comment concrete, specific transactions in the U.K. But we do think that we have a very attractive market in terms of tower, and some movements would take place in the next quarters. But again, I wouldn't like to somehow forget other markets like France, in which also there will be some assets coming into the market in the next quarters. Germany, today, we saw that even Telxius were somehow doing intercompany transaction. So this -- we'll keep an eye open not only on what is [indiscernible], which is Italy but also on other countries around Continental Europe.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016

Do you think that this can be different in case of Telxius listed and so competing basically for the same organic growth?

componenttextpreview: The cash advances, sorry, yes. You are right, you are right. Sorry, I -- the cash advances, it's clear we are, yes, investing in this EUR 6 million. So step by step, we should present to you the evolution of these cash advances. So for sure in Q3 and Q4,
componenttext: The cash advances, sorry, yes. You are right, you are right. Sorry, I -- the cash advances, it's clear we are, yes, investing in this EUR 6 million. So step by step, we should present to you the evolution of these cash advances. So for sure in Q3 and Q4, you will be able already to realize that there has been a positive impact. Let's say, to be prudent, at the 2016 results, you will see good numbers. And regarding the competition of Telxius and other partners in -- other potential, sorry, towering companies in Europe, it is true, and this is something that it is happening now. So in Italy, that competition -- competition is defined by the number of suppliers and demand. And -- but in this case, also I would like to highlight the neutrality option. So being neutral has also a plus in the market, and I think that this can have an impact, obviously Telxius, in our organic growth. But somehow, we feel confident that our neutral position will help us to somehow mitigate or decrease the negative effect.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Additionally, Domenico, what -- in this specific case, I would like to highlight that the way we've been creating our portfolio in Spain has been precisely acquiring towers from Telefonica. So I would say the overlap between the 2 networks is very limited
componenttext: Additionally, Domenico, what -- in this specific case, I would like to highlight that the way we've been creating our portfolio in Spain has been precisely acquiring towers from Telefonica. So I would say the overlap between the 2 networks is very limited, so we still believe we have a unique positioning in Spain. Also, the -- our current portfolio is the result of a very strict due diligence. We made sure that our towers were attractive commercially so that is still the -- that is still our belief.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sorry, just one more question, coming back to the Inwit transaction. I was wondering if you had any view on the change of management at Telecom Italia. And given that you've had a little bit of feedback, I think is what you said at the start of the call,
componenttext: Sorry, just one more question, coming back to the Inwit transaction. I was wondering if you had any view on the change of management at Telecom Italia. And given that you've had a little bit of feedback, I think is what you said at the start of the call, on the bidding process, does that change of management -- and obviously, the influence within the shareholder base, does that change the objective of Telecom Italia with respect to the ownership of Inwit? And does it change the framework of the bids from their perspective? Are they looking for different aspects within a bid from before? If you could share something on that, that'd be really great. And just also a smaller additional question. Is there any update on your backhauling of sites, so the fiber backhauling? I was kind of -- have you had much interaction with MNOs on that yet?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 15, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Backhauling, I think we are doing -- we are also doing progress here and -- step by step. And this is also interesting organic growth line that, at some point, we should present to you. It will take a little bit more time, but we are happy with the p
componenttext: Yes. Backhauling, I think we are doing -- we are also doing progress here and -- step by step. And this is also interesting organic growth line that, at some point, we should present to you. It will take a little bit more time, but we are happy with the progress. So yes, let's leave it there. Regarding the Inwit and Telecom Italia new management, well, listen, this is -- I am not the best-positioned person to answer this question. But I assume that as in any other company, when there is a change of CEO, the new CEO wants to take a little bit of time to rethink everything, to reassess different ways, different mechanisms or maybe the next steps or just to go into details, which is the most useful thing that can happen in this kind of big, big companies of EUR 14 billion, EUR 15 billion market cap. So I'm pretty sure that at the end of the day, logic will prevail. And I'm pretty sure that rational decision-makers in previous and current management will make decisions that increase the share value of all the shareholders of Telecom Italia. From this angle and this professional angle, I am pretty sure that Cellnex is best positioned to offer the best offer not only for Telecom Italia but also for every single minority in Inwit that would like to have the same opportunities. And this is the Cellnex offer: open, clear. And I will say to you that challenging -- in terms of price, in terms of contract, in terms of it -- it's good for everyone. It's a win-win agreement for everyone.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan,Head of the Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by Alex Mestre, International Business Development Director; and José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, and who will lead today's presentation
componenttext:
Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan,
Head of the Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by Alex Mestre, International Business Development Director; and José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, and who will lead today's presentation. I would like to thank you for joining us today for Cellnex H1 2016 Results Conference Call. We have, earlier today, posted a presentation, which we will refer to throughout our prepared remarks under the Investor Relations section on our website. And then we'll open the line for a Q&A session. So now I'll hand over to José Manuel. Please, José Manuel.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon. Thank you so much for your time today and please allow me to start by highlighting the main milestones of the period. We are in Page 4. Here, you can see that today, will present them again a solid set of results that confirm the market ex
componenttext:
Good afternoon. Thank you so much for your time today and please allow me to start by highlighting the main milestones of the period. We are in Page 4. Here, you can see that today, will present them again a solid set of results that confirm the market expectations for the period. We have also resume our M&A activity by executing 2 value accretive deals while establishing our presence in very dynamic markets. We are best positioned candidate to consolidate the European tower landscape. We're also taking the first few steps to become the European leader in antenna systems sector. 
From operations perspective, our efficiency plan is on track while we have also recovered TV revenues we lost in the past. And finally, we are glad to announce that Cellnex has been included in the Ibex 35 Index. 
Moving now to Slide 5. In terms of activities, we have managed to increase the number of PoPs by 2% compared to December 2015. We are also paving the way to boost our presence in the DAS business by acquiring provides today DAS services in 83 locations in Italy and is analyzing many additional projects in environments where an important demand for mobile data is seen. We continue to assess the possibility to invest in fiber to the tower for our customers, and we are making good progress on this front. were's closely monitoring and proactively analyzing potential new opportunities that might arise from the consolidation of the 4 mobile operator role across Europe. 
Finally, we continue to pursue rationalization projects with mobile operators and we are working hard to reach an agreement in the short term. 
Regarding broadcasting, we can confirm that they profits for TV channels have successfully been completed with all Chinese broadcasting and generated earnings from April, thus, providing a stable revenue earnings going forward. 
Regarding the network services and others, we continue to see a solid performance, faster connectivity and emergency communications businesses. It is important to highlight that when we enter any country, we pursue new services levering on our Telecom Site Rental activity. Finally, we keep analyzing anything of opportunity at hand to continue creating value for our shareholders. And one such opportunity is our efficiency program on which we are making good progress according to retaining our share with you. 
Turning to Slide 6. You can see here the evolution of PoPs and our resulting consolidated tenancy ratio, with increases being explained by consistent organic growth rates. We have managed to add more than 400 PoPs in the period reaching a tenancy ratio of 1.56, a 4% increase when compared to June 2015 and a 2% increase when compared to December 2015. 
On the next chart, you can find the comprehensive destination of the performance of revenues in the Telecom Site Rental business. You can see how the shifting asset base contributes EUR 4 million to our consolidated while the change of perimeter add EUR 54 million in this period. 
When you go to adjusted EBITDA, you can see how the relative impact of the that took place in 2015, which was a one-off positive effect, is more than offset by the switch in our new TV channel [indiscernible] the change of and the contribution for organic growth, which represent EUR 4 million in the period. 
Let me now explain in detail on Slide 7, our recurring leverage free cash flow generation in the period. I would like to start by highlighting the back cash conversion ratio TPH into current level free cash flow in the period has been 94%, with current cash flow increasing by 24%. 
Looking now to revenues. Telecom Site Rental increases mainly due to our stroll organic growth and acquisitions. The broadcasting business reflects now the new TV channels in April when compared to the previous quarter, and there were services continued a solid performance, mainly due to a high activity in the connectivity business. 
Moving to OpEx. We have a very well contained cost base with a flat performance on a like-for-like basis. The increase is mainly due to cost directly associated with our recent transactions. Our adjusted EBITDA reached EUR 134 million, in line with our guidance for the full year, and so in a strong 17% increase when compared to last year. 
Maintenance CapEx is well below our 3% guidance for the year, due to effect and to catch up within this year to reach a more normalized level. 
Our working capital change is neutral for the period, thanks to our strict management and in line with our full year guidance. 
Interest paid reflect our current with the first coupon associated with our bond paid this week, therefore, to be considered for the next quarter. And that reflect the implementation of that management measures, as well as the tax payment scheduled in the year. 
Non-M&A expansion CapEx include the first step of our efficiency program with EUR 12 million associated with cash advances in the context of the renegotiation of our leases. 
Moving now to our balance sheet on Slide 8. Cellnex leverage has decreased to 3.3x net debt annualized EBITDA, well below our long-term objective of 4x. Our total net debt is EUR 872 million, with our bond accounting for most of the debt. We're now setting the change in net debt and this to take in account, that in general, we paid the second tranche of Volta Extended phase 2, and in June, we paid acquisition of We will provide all these details in the that is in our website. 
We have also paid our final dividend in July, bringing the total to around EUR 20 million, approximately 20% of the recurring levered free cash flow generated in the second half of 2015, in accordance with our dividend policy. 
Coming back to the remaining lines of our income statement, depreciation and amortization increased mainly as a result of our recent acquisitions. And interest expense increased in line with our capital structure. 
Moving to Slide 9. You can see on the left-hand side our capital structure, with near liquidity lines having been signed at a very competitive cost of around 1%, alone for new upcoming growth opportunities. 
On the right-hand side, you can see also our debt maturities compared to our cash flow generation in a cumulative basis. We can, therefore, in summary, say that we face no financial risk due to the long term of our debt and our cash flow generation capacity. We have improved our liquidity position and we have a solid credit rating with our Standard & Poor's outlook having been improved recently. On that our recent acquisition have been financed at a very low marginal cost. 
So now regarding the M&A update. Given our activity during the last weeks, we believe it is worth offering a brief recap of our last year's and also provide some additional background on how these transactions fit into our equity story. If we now moved to Slide 11. You can see a summary of our recent activity. 251 towers in Poland, an agreement with to write up to 500 towers in France and acquisition of in Italy. This deal represent the first step into very dynamic market. They allow us to diversify in countries with a strong credit rating. Hopefully, it is the right platform from which continue to assess and [indiscernible] consolidation opportunities and, therefore, confirm the delivery on our equity story. 
And Slide 12, you can see a picture of the new perimeter as a result of the recent transactions. More markets, more diversified client base, more focused portfolio on Telecom Site Rental revenues. All in all, we can clearly state that after these decisions, our business risk profile has improved. 
Moving to Slide 13. You can see here a table that shows how to think about capital generation from our recent acquisition. The cash conversion ratio turn EBITDA into recurrent levered free cash flow is 85%. So I think this figure is very high. The new deals are expected to generate EUR 12 million on a full year basis in terms of recurring leverage free cash flow. This represents around 10% of recurring cash flow generated in the first semester 2016, and all this has been achieved always by applying our strict investment criteria. 
So now if you assess the different opportunities one after the other, first of all, on Slide 14, you can see a more detailed assessment of our DAS deal that was closed first day of July. The main idea I would like to highlight is that we are entering a new market with a strong anchor tenant, providing with revenues visibility and we follow on opportunities that should come in the next quarters. 
Also, there are other characteristics of this deal, such as the high proportion of revenues guaranteed with new clients, in this case, KPI until 2017, 2018. The scheme, which is indexed to CPI having a flow at 0%. 
And finally, I would like to say that 20% of the sites that we've acquired overlaps with existing 15 networks of operators. 
On the Slide 16 -- sorry, 15. Here, we present the French opportunity, and this project as an industrial project that sets the foundation for a long-term partnership with a key European player like [indiscernible]. One example of this future cooperation is our preemptive right to build up to 250 sites for our anchor tenant. It is important to highlight that this acquisition, unlike the Dutch one, consist on the acquisition of assets of towers. Also, there are other characteristics that make this opportunity unique, such as a very long-term contract of 20 years and also a 2% annual fix fee escalator. 
Moving now to Italy on Slide 16. The acquisition of CommsCon represents the opportunity for Cellnex to become the DAS benchmark in Europe. We believe the DAS market has a huge potential and will position Cellnex in the future DAS sector as [indiscernible] there a lot. This acquisition provide us with a first-mover advantage, and the know-how required to achieve this leadership. We do really think that CommsCon is ideal platform to capture what we think we need, a very significant market in the next years. 
At the end of the day, CommsCon will help us to cover or to improve the coverage that we can provide from our infrastructures. 
Finally, on Slide 17, we present what we call the domino affect, the strategy that we have been implementing for our European expansion. Our intention is to continue acquiring small portfolios in new countries so that we can increase our understanding of the market, build a strong relationship with the aim to continue consolidated market by pursuing new opportunities. This is what we have successfully done in the past, and the path that we would follow in order to become the European consolidator. 
In Slide 19, just some closing remarks. We are presenting today a solid set of results. We are happy to deliver our equity story, not only from a point perspective but also from M&A activity. We continued to replace the very well position to consolidate the European tower landscape. We are taking the first step to become the European leader in the new technologies at a step-by-step far more important like the DAS. Current operations are strong and our efficiency plan is on track. And finally, Cellnex has been included in the [indiscernible] 35 has already improved the visibility, the liquidity and attractiveness of our store, as you can see on Page 20.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, thank you, very much. Regarding your first question, which was France, Poland and the next steps and time frame. In fact, I think in page -- in the annex in Page 22, you can find the market description of the Netherlands and France. And you can see
componenttext:
Okay, thank you, very much. Regarding your first question, which was France, Poland and the next steps and time frame. In fact, I think in page -- in the annex in Page 22, you can find the market description of the Netherlands and France. And you can see how, for instance, in the Netherlands, there are different tower costs and there's a footnote that is displaying which tower cost there are there. so we are talking at least 1,200 towers from Tower Company. And on top of that, other that have already, let's say, 13,000 towers. We will think that the market is moving and we will
To consolidate in the next quarters. Again, the question is always execution versus value criteria. We have to give you an answer regarding when, it is very important to understand the criteria also requirement, so it's not easy to tell you. The thing is, we are working on that. We are monitoring this market pretty closely. Also, the French market, French market, again, in Page 22, you can see that there are different elements with, let's say, around 50,000 towers. And some tower with 10,000 towers. You all know it is market, it is public information that some of these tower costs potentially might be on sale in the next quarter in competitive process from a public perspective, we can't say that, at least there will be one opportunity in France, hopefully. Your second question was regarding the OpEx. In fact, you were asking about the capital bonds program that we have. First of all, let me tell you that in the capital bond is working as expected. And we're pretty sure we can get this EUR 15 million by 2019, I think was the target. This year, I think if we go on investing, we are investing around EUR 3 million, EUR 2 million, let's say, EUR 2 million, EUR 3 million, depending on the timing effect can be obtained. Please be aware that this is, if you invest 1 year, for instance, EUR 20 million in cash advance, it's not the same investing this EUR 20 million the first day of the year or the last day of the year. So it depends. At this time frame have an impact on 2015 numbers. However, all these transactions always follow our very strict criteria. So the payback will be if not this year, next year.  Finally, regarding the consolidation of the market, the 2,000 towers Again, same message as previous quarters. I think we are working a lot and I'm pretty sure that we will present to you an interesting deal, I think longer than expected, to be honest. However, it is taking longer because also I don't think that Cellnex is opening this market and providing very good ideas and new angles that have to be explored. Pretty sure that will come out one day to the market and do something positive, or at least you will see quarter-over-quarter that the number of towers change, and therefore, PoPs grow.

componenttext: Yes, sure, José Manuel. On relation to the spectrum, we think it's true that the 700 megahertz is something that the [indiscernible] conference at a certain point in time is required to do a relocation of the usage of the band. Remember, like remember we have the 800 megahertz has already been cleared and now being used for 4G. Also, I would like to emphasize the concept of the lower the frequencies, the longer the range. So I believe that when always looking for identification, we have more kind of more cells, more microcells, more DAS that José Manuel has been explaining in one of the trends as of now. Those are our frequencies are less interesting because the coverage is much wider than higher frequency. So in relation to the lower frequencies are not as useful as the higher frequencies. In relation to the 700 megahertz, it is clear that the number of stages in Europe has to prepare This is something that will occur during -- in 2017. Some of the countries have an accelerated plan in relation to that but when research that in countries like Spain, and as a result also of the latest, let's say, propositions which is having, in Europe, we ended up don't want to happen before 2022. And it is the period that has been the frequency possible, so within 2020, 2022. And, importantly, during that process and that time, until then, the broadcasting terminology will be evolved, is able to do an evolution, it would be too higher compression mechanisms that will keep the overall offer of channels, even in migrating them to high definition, then equal as what we have today. So in that sense, we expect that in the those countries, specifically in Spain, where we have broadcasting presence as of today, we will remain with a similar offer in terms of digital this activity channels.

I do think that the results are good and I would like to confirm all the guidelines that we did at the beginning of the year for 2016. I think the company is performing well. Full year results 2016 will follow the guideline we gave and I think it was in February 2016 [indiscernible] H2 2015 results. So on track with M&A opportunity that will create value. And with adjusted EBITDA that will come as the market is steady and also with very strong free cash flow that will be in line or even slightly than the market consensus. So looking forward to you again in Q2 results. In the meantime, we are here if you have any questions.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan,Head of the Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by Alex Mestre, International Business Development Director; and José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, and who will lead today's presentation
componenttext:
Good afternoon, everyone. My name is Juan Gaitan,
Head of the Investor Relations at Cellnex. I'm joined today by Alex Mestre, International Business Development Director; and José Manuel Aisa, CFO and M&A Director, and who will lead today's presentation. I would like to thank you for joining us today for Cellnex H1 2016 Results Conference Call. We have, earlier today, posted a presentation, which we will refer to throughout our prepared remarks under the Investor Relations section on our website. And then we'll open the line for a Q&A session.
So now I'll hand over to José Manuel. Please, José Manuel.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon. Thank you so much for your time today. And please allow me to start by highlighting the main milestones of the period. We are in Page 4. Here, you can see that today, we're presenting again a solid set of results that confirm the market ex
componenttext:
Good afternoon. Thank you so much for your time today. And please allow me to start by highlighting the main milestones of the period. We are in Page 4. Here, you can see that today, we're presenting again a solid set of results that confirm the market expectations for the period. We have also resume our M&A activity by executing 2 value-accretive deals, while establishing our presence in very dynamic markets. We are best positioned candidate to consolidate the European tower landscape. We're also taking the first steps to become the European leader in the distributed antenna systems sector.
From operations perspective, our efficiency plan is on track, while we have also recovered TV revenues we lost in the past. And finally, we are glad to announce that Cellnex has been included in the IBEX 35 Index.
Moving now to Slide 5. In terms of activities, we have managed to increase the number of PoPs by 2% compared to December 2015. We are also paving the way to boost our presence in the DAS business by acquiring CommsCon. CommsCon provides today DAS services in 83 locations in Italy and is analyzing many additional projects in environments where an important demand for mobile data is seen. We continue to assess the possibility to invest in fiber backhauling to the tower for our customers, and we are making good progress on this front. We're closely monitoring and proactively analyzing potential new opportunities that might arise from the consolidation of the fourth mobile operator role across Europe.
Finally, we continue to pursue rationalization projects with mobile operators, and we are working hard to reach an agreement in the short term.
Regarding broadcasting, we can confirm that the retendering process of the 6 new TV channels have successfully been completed with all Chinese broadcasting and generating earnings from April, thus, providing a stable revenue release, going forward.
Regarding the network services and others, we continue to see a solid performance, faster connectivity and emergency communications businesses. It is important to highlight that we -- that when we enter any country, we pursue new services levering on our Telecom Site Rental activity.
Finally, we keep analyzing any single opportunity at hand to continue creating value for our shareholders. And one such opportunity is our efficiency program, on which we are making good progress according to the timing I really share with you.
Turning to Slide 6. You can see here the evolution of PoPs and our resulting consolidated tenancy ratio, with increases being explained by consistent organic growth rates. We have managed to add more than 400 PoPs in the period reaching a tenancy ratio of 1.56, a 4% increase when compared to June 2015 and a 2% increase when compared to December 2015.
On the next chart, you can find a comprehensive destination of the performance of revenues in the Telecom Site Rental business. You can see how the shifting asset base contributes EUR 4 million to our consolidated figures, while the change of perimeter adds EUR 54 million in this period.
When we've not adjusted EBITDA, you can see how the negative impact of the DTT single cut that took place in 2015, which was a one-off positive effect, is more than offset by the switch on our new TV channels, the change of perimeter and the contribution of organic growth, which represent EUR 4 million in the period.
Let me now explain in detail on Slide 7, our recurring levered free cash flow generation in the period. I would like to start by highlighting that the cash conversion ratio of EBITDA into current level free cash flow in the period has been 94%, with current cash flow increasing by 24%.
Looking now to revenues. Telecom Site Rental increases mainly due to our strong organic growth and acquisitions. The broadcasting business reflects now the new TV channels from April when compared to the previous quarter. And network services and other continue showing a solid performance, mainly due to a high activity in the connectivity business.
Moving to OpEx. We have a very well-contained cost base with a flat performance on a like-for-like basis. The increase is mainly due to cost directly associated with our recent transactions. Our adjusted EBITDA reached EUR 134 million, in line with our guidance for the full year, and so in a strong 17% increase when compared to last year.
Maintenance CapEx is well below our 3% guidance for the year, due to a time effect and is expected to catch up within this year to reach a more normalized level.
Our working capital change is neutral for the period, thanks to our strict management, and in line with our full year guidance.
Interest paid reflect our current capital structure with the first coupon associated with our bond paid this week, therefore, to be considered for the next quarter. And tax pay reflect the implementation of that management measure as well as the tax payment scheduled in the year.
Non-M&A expansion CapEx include the first step of our efficiency program with EUR 12 million associated with cash advances in the context or the renegotiation of our leases.
Moving now to our balance sheet on Slide 8. Cellnex leverage has decreased to 3.3x net debt annualized EBITDA, well below our long-term objective of 4x. Our total net debt is EUR 872 million, with our bond accounting for most of the debt. We're now setting the change in net debt and is to be taken into account. That in general, we paid the second tranche of Volta Extended phase 2. And in June, we paid acquisition of CommsCon. You will find all these details in the excel sheet that is in our website. 
We have also paid our final dividend in July, bringing the total distribution to around EUR 20 million, approximately 20% of the recurring levered free cash flow generated in the second half of 2015, in accordance with our dividend policy.
Coming back to the remaining lines of our income statement, depreciation and amortization credits increased mainly as a result of our recent acquisitions. And interest expense increased in line with our capital structure.
Moving to Slide 9. You can see on the left-hand side our capital structure, with near liquidity lines having been signed at a very competitive cost of around 1%, alone for new upcoming growth opportunities.
On the right-hand side, you can see also our debt maturities profile compared to our cash flow generation in a cumulative basis. We can, therefore, in summary, say that we face no refinancing risk due to the long-term [indiscernible] of our debt and our cash flow generation capacity. We have improved our liquidity position. And we have a solid credit rating with our Standard & Poor's outlook having been improved recently. On that, our recent acquisition have been financed at a very low marginal cost.
So now regarding the M&A update. Given our high M&A activity, during the last weeks, we believe it is worth offering a brief recap of our last year's and also provide some additional background on how these transactions fit into our equity story. 
If we now move to Slide 11. You can see a summary of our recent activity. 251 towers in Holland. An agreement with Bouygues to right up to 500 towers in France and acquisition of Commscon in Italy. These deals represent the first step into very dynamic market. They allow us to diversify into countries with a strong credit rating. Hopefully, next, the right platform from which continue to assess and [indiscernible] consolidation opportunities, and therefore, confirm the delivery on our equity story.
On Slide 12, you can see a picture of a new Cellnex perimeter as a result of the recent transactions. More markets, more diversified client base, more focused portfolio on Telecom Site Rental revenues. All-in-all, we can clearly state that after these appreciations, our business risk profile has improved.
Moving to Slide 13. You can see here a table that shows how to think about capital generation from our recent acquisition. The cash conversion ratio from EBITDA into recurrent levered free cash flow is 85%. So I think this figure is very, very high. The new deals are expected to generate EUR 12 million on a full year basis in terms of recurring levered free cash flow. This represents around 10% of the recurring cash flow generated in the first semester 2016, and all this has been achieved always by applying our strict investment criteria.
So now if we assess the different opportunities one after the other, first of all, on Slide 14, you can see a more detailed assessment of our DAS deal that we'll close the first day of July. The main idea I would like to highlight is that we are entering a new market with a strong anchor tenant, providing with revenues visibility, and we follow on opportunities that should come in the next quarter. 
Also, there are other characteristics of this deal, such as the high proportion of revenues guaranteed with new clients, in this case, KPN, until 2017, 2018. The tariff scheme, which is in Brexit to CPI having a flow at 0%.
And finally, I would like to say that 20% of the sites that we've acquired overlaps with existing networks of our operators.
On the Slide 16 -- sorry, 15. Here, we present the French opportunity, and this project is an industrial project that sets the foundation for a long-term partnership with a key European player, like Bouygues. One example of this future cooperation is our preemptive right to build up to 250 sites for our anchor tenant. It is important to highlight that this acquisition, unlike the Dutch one, consist on the acquisition of assets of towers. Also, there are other characteristics that make this opportunity unique, such as a very long-term contract of 20 years and also a 2% annual fix fee escalator.
Moving now to Italy on Slide 16. The acquisition of CommsCon represents the opportunity for Cellnex to become the DAS benchmark in Europe. We believe the DAS market has a huge potential and will position Cellnex in the future DAS sector as it is developed. This acquisition provides us with a first-mover advantage and the knowhow required to achieve this leadership. We do really think that CommsCon is a unique platform to capture what we think really a very significant market in the next years.
At the end of the day, CommsCon will help us to cover -- or to improve the coverage that we can provide from our infrastructures.
Finally, on Slide 17, we present what we call the domino affect, the strategy that we have been implementing for our European expansion. Our intention is to continue acquiring small portfolios in new countries so that we can increase our understanding of the market, build a strong relationship with the aim to continue consolidated [indiscernible] market by pursuing new opportunities. This is what we have successfully done in the past, and is a path that we would follow in order to become the European consolidator.
In Slide 19, just some closing remarks. We are presenting today a solid set of results. We are happy to deliver our equity story, not only from a revenue perspective but also from M&A activity. We continued to replace very well position to consolidate the European tower landscape. We are taking the first step to become the European leader in the new technologies at a step-by-step far more important like the DAS. Current operations are strong, and our efficiency plan is on track. And finally, Cellnex has been included in the IBEX 35. It has already improved the visibility, the liquidity and attractiveness of our store, as you can see in Page 20.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Three questions from my side. First one on M&A. You could comment a bit on what your intention are in France and Holland after your first acquisitions? What is your view, the critical portfolio size, you would like to achieve? And if you could give a bit
componenttext: Three questions from my side. First one on M&A. You could comment a bit on what your intention are in France and Holland after your first acquisitions? What is your view, the critical portfolio size, you would like to achieve? And if you could give a bit of guidance on time frame you think you will need to achieve the optimal portfolio size? And then maybe something on an update on the Hutchison portfolio in Italy? That's first question. Second, an OpEx, I understand you could roughly save EUR 50 million from these negotiations over the next 3 to 4 years. Now my question is, how much of that amount do you expect to achieve this year? Then last question on the Russian evasion process, and 2,000 towers decommissioning you guided to during full year results. Could you give some update on that?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, thank you. Thank you very much. Regarding your first question, which was France, Holland and the next steps and time frame. In fact, I think in page -- in the annex in Page 22, you can find the market description of the Netherlands and France. And y
componenttext:
Okay, thank you. Thank you very much. Regarding your first question, which was France, Holland and the next steps and time frame. In fact, I think in page -- in the annex in Page 22, you can find the market description of the Netherlands and France. And you can see how, for instance, in the Netherlands, there are different tower costs. And there's a footnote that is displaying which tower cost there are there. So we are talking at least 1,200 towers from Tower Company. And on top of that, there are other MNOs that have already, let's say, 13,000 towers. We will think that the market is moving, and there will some angle to consolidate in the next quarter.
Again, the question is always execution versus value criterion. We have to give you an answer regarding when it is very important to understand the criteria's requirement. So it's not easy to tell you. The thing is, we are working on that. We are monitoring this market pretty closely. Also, the French market, French market, again, in Page 22, you can see that there are different MNOs with, let's say, around 50,000 towers. And some TowerCos with 10,000 towers. You all know and it is market -- it is public information that some of these TowerCos potentially may be on sale in the next quarter in competitive process from a public perspective, we can say that, at least. There will be one opportunity in France, hopefully. Your second question was regarding the OpEx. In fact, you were asking about the capital bonds program that we have. First of all, let me tell you that the [indiscernible] program is working as expected. And we're pretty sure we can get this EUR 15 million by 2019, I think, it was the target. This year, I think that if we go on investing as we are investing around EUR 3 million, EUR 2 million, let's say, EUR 2 million or EUR 3 million depending the timing effect can be obtained. Please be aware that this is, if you invest 1 year, for instance, EUR 20 million in cash advance, it's not the same investing this EUR 20 million at first day of the year or the last date of the year. So it depends. At this time frame have an impact on 2015 numbers. However, all these transactions always follow our very strict criteria. So the payback will there, if not this year, next year. Finally, regarding the consolidation of the market, the 2,000 towers [indiscernible] this month, again, same message as previous quarters. I think we are working a lot and I'm pretty sure that we will present to you an interesting deal. The thing is that each day longer than expected, to be honest. However, it is taking longer because also I don't think that Cellnex is opening this market and providing very good ideas and new angles that have to be explored. Pretty sure that we will come out one day to the market with something positive. Or at least you will see quarter-by-quarter that the number of towers change, and therefore, the PoPs grow, right?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Next question is from Giles Thorne from Jefferies.
componenttext: Next question is from Giles Thorne from Jefferies.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: I had 3 questions, please. Starting in Italy, as we consider the implications of Italian MNO consolidation, it would be good to progress the debate from the organic growth opportunities of new entrants to now better understanding, in your view, what your
componenttext: I had 3 questions, please. Starting in Italy, as we consider the implications of Italian MNO consolidation, it would be good to progress the debate from the organic growth opportunities of new entrants to now better understanding, in your view, what your P&L is, as an industrial partner as Iliad relative to your competition in Italy? And staying in Italy, I really have an extension of the previous question. As we look at the accelerated investments announced earlier this week by Inwit, it's clear that TI is probably now not a seller of that state, so given M&A is off the table and also given Inwit is investing to drive growth, do you have any reason to change your capital allocation in Italy? And lastly, on spectrum, at the end of May, we saw the GSMA again pushed for a more aggressive time line for the reconsideration of the sub-700 megahertz band for alternative uses. It'd be interesting to hear your perspective on this development? And how this shift is debated at all for the outlook, for DTT in the sub-700 megahertz band, if at all?

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you Giles for your questions. Let me split your questions into parts, 1 and 2 will be answered by myself, and the third one I will invite Alex Mestre, who is the International Director to answer to your question in the GSM 700 megahertz. Giles, I th
componenttext: Thank you Giles for your questions. Let me split your questions into parts, 1 and 2 will be answered by myself, and the third one I will invite Alex Mestre, who is the International Director to answer to your question in the GSM 700 megahertz. Giles, I think, your first and second question, I think both come at the same time. We are not going to change our plan because of our peer is changing their CapEx plan. I mean, we will have to go on working, following our internal targets with a criteria we have in order to create value for our shareholders. We think that the Italian market, from my perspective, presents a lot of opportunities, one of them being the fourth operator. Obviously, Cellnex is keeping twice on this process, and I think we have the open to asses with different candidates in this opportunity. I think that Cellnex is very well positioned. Cellnex has, let's say, a tenancy ratio in Italy which is 1.2x. So it gives us headroom to grow, give us headroom to put more tenants into our towers as a place now that Italy presents a very demanding electromagnetic revolution. So in this case, having a low tenancy ratio is helpful to grow, is helpful to offer new PoPs. And second, also, I don't think that we are very well positioned to play a key role in this fourth operator and process because we are neutral operator. We are independent tower company, so we do not have any MNO on our shareholding base, and therefore, it will give us headroom, will give us flexibility to treat all our customers in the same way with the same criteria. So I do think that Cellnex is doing -- working -- doing good progress, but always we're not very confidential basis and on a very prudent basis, step-by-step. I don't know if Alex Mestre, you can help me to answer the third question.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, sure, José Manuel. On relation to the spectrum, I think it's true that the 700 megahertz is something that the World Radio Conference is also [indiscernible] that at certain point in time, it is required to do a reallocation of the usage of the band
componenttext: Yes, sure, José Manuel. On relation to the spectrum, I think it's true that the 700 megahertz is something that the World Radio Conference is also [indiscernible] that at certain point in time, it is required to do a reallocation of the usage of the band. Remember, like remember, we have the 800 megahertz has already been cleared and now is being used for 4G. Also, I would like to emphasize the concept of the lower the frequencies, the longer the range. So I believe that when an MNO is looking for identification, using -- traveling more kind of a small cells, more microcells, more DAS that José Manuel has been explaining in one of the trends as of now. Those frequencies are less interesting because the coverage is much wider than higher frequency. So in relation, identification in the lower frequencies are not as useful as the higher frequencies. In relation to the 700 megahertz, it is clear that the number of stages in Europe have to prepare their clients. This is something that will occur during -- in 2017. Some of the countries have an accelerated plan in relation to that, but when research that in countries like Spain, and as a result also of the latest, let's say, prepositions which is having, in Europe, we understood that it is not going to happen before 2022. And it is the period that has been the frequency rate possible, also within 2020, 2022. And, importantly, during that process and that time, until then, the broadcasting terminologies that will evolve, is able to do an evolution. It will be maybe [indiscernible] visibility to higher compression mechanisms that will keep the overall offer of channels, even migrating them to high definition, very equal as we have today. So in that sense, we expect that in those countries, specifically in Spain, where we have the broadcasting presence as of today, we will remain with a similar offer in terms of digital [indiscernible] than rest of the channels.

componenttext: Yes. So it is true in that process having several candidates. Let's remember that the process has yet to be cleared, in terms of the [indiscernible] by European competition authorities. It is intended to happen beginning of September. From that point onwards, what is expected is that the final candidate [indiscernible] will be the one finally getting into the agreement -- with the new merged entity. It is true having other candidates. We've been having discussions logically with all of them. And our value proposition has been, we understand, properly understood, especially in relation to what José Manuel was saying that the low tenancy ratio, in that case, where we are now, it is an advantage because it allows us, let's say, to fit very quickly and in a very big amount of number of sites and new mobile network operator.

componenttext: The next question is from Ottavio Adorisio from Societe Generale.

headline: Cellnex Telecom, S.A., H1 2016 Earnings Call, Jul 29, 2016
componenttextpreview: Few questions. I think, let me go in order. It should be relatively straightforward. The very first line is on France. You mentioned that there should be a follow-up deal for the 270 towers. Do you also think that we have similar terms in terms of length
componenttext: Few questions. I think, let me go in order. It should be relatively straightforward. The very first line is on France. You mentioned that there should be a follow-up deal for the 270 towers. Do you also think that we have similar terms in terms of length and EBITDA contribution. The second one is on credit. You show in the appendix, a chart, where it looks like the yield on your bond gradually falling for a number of regions. And so my question is, considering you still finance yourself with [indiscernible] facility, there would be no time now to turn that short- to medium-term credit facility in a long-term bond? The third is on CommsCon. Now it's a slightly different -- this is broader than what we've seen in previous deals. The other deals you've got a lot of clarity in terms of the length, and therefore, it's easier to model from our standpoint. Here today, you showed a contribution around EUR 1.5 million on EBITDA. So the question is how secure is EBITDA? What sort of length in the contract we got behind? And what are the ultimate payers for that particular -- underpin [ph] that EBITDA and then also third party? And the very last one, and that one, it's a small [indiscernible] than everything else. We talk a lot about this [indiscernible] a lot of contract and the fact that WIND cannot get half of that contract. But can we, with your approval, basically on a tower-to-tower basis potentially pass the contract to another operator? I mean, we're not talking about newcomers. Of course, nothing at WIND and Hutchison had complete their business plan in terms of the towers they want to get out. But in case they basically they try that, for them, it will be good to get out of some of the towers in which they sold to you, and of course, they locked for 15 years. But if they pay or if they negotiate with you, would you be willing to basically for them to sell the contract onto a third party?
